description: b'Authentic Northern Chinese cuisine ... even the atmosphere is authentic (ie more Neon than nostalgic ;) ) Chinese. Great food with pork as mainstay. Oh, and craft beers. Best to come with at least 3 diners to samples some variety (Chinese, not European dishes served here).'

b"If this is the best Chinese food that Berlin had to offer... wow... maybe someone should take a trip to China. 

Although the service was friendly and the menu seeming authentic with the inclusion of a few north eastern Chinese dishes, this is meals are aimed at the German palate, if your palate favors the toning down of flavors this place is for you. 

When it comes to looking for authentic tasting food, I'll steer clear of local reviewers thanks. Although I did have pretty tasty Chinese food in Frankfurt, so maybe it's just a Berliner thing."
b'Authentic cuisine, pretty good! We enjoyed the cucumber salad/ dumplings/ salt and pepper prawns/ bok choy w shiitake/ sour soup fish.'

b'Relatively cheap and pretty authentic chinese restaurant. The servers are super nice and friendly so I want to give 5 stars for that.

Food was also pretty authentic although the choice was a bit limited. The duck was pretty good and crispy but yuxiangrousi \xe9\xb1\xbc\xe9\xa6\x99\xe8\x82\x89\xe4\xb8\x9d was a bit too sweet. The fried rice was ok. And the bokchoy and mushroom was good \xe9\xa6\x99\xe8\x8f\x87\xe6\xb2\xb9\xe8\x8f\x9c. Guobai \xe9\x94\x85\xe5\x8c\x85 was great (i believe the place is \xe4\xb8\x9c\xe5\x8c\x97 dongbei food. They also gave us free white rice! 

The food took a while to come out and the choice was somehow more limited than in the Bay area/california (i know this sounds weird since they have pages of food but they lack some super common authentic chinese dishes--- which to be fair not many people might order those here?) 

Otherwise, super good service, tasty food at decent price! Cannot ask for more for a chinese restaurant in Berlin!'

b'Very good place for dinner, friendly servers, some dishes can serve up to two people. I recommend asking for the spring roll of entry - 2.80 euros. Recommend the dish with chicken fingers and vegetables - 9.90 euros.'
b'Very authentic Chinese restaurant. Everything is well prepared and tasty, even the "Westernized" dishes.\nService is a bit quirky but friendly. Totally recommended'

b"Well tickle me pink!  I had gone past this restaurant so many times and thought ummm meh because I have to admit it's not so welcoming looking from the outside. I also peered through the windows at night whilst passing in the car a couple of times and thought nah! Then I saw the reviews on yelp and thought seriously?

Having joined the yelp community and met some of the reviewers I thought...Yes seriously this must be good. So I took my little cold to try out something spicy.

Well we only ordered three dishes, I would have liked to have gone all Asian but I would have needed the stomach of a cow with it's four chambers to get through it all... on that subject you can indeed order stomach, trotters, tripe and the like should you so wish. We ordered Sichuan Style Tofu, Peking styled fried pork with pancakes and the Pork, shrimp, egg and vegetable dumplings. 

The dumplings were a good size and tasty. The tofu was firm and had a lovely spice to it, just right to unblock my nose! The pork wrapped in pancakes was delicious too. Portions are generous and we were really quite stuffed. Thankfully my friend knows me quite well and stopped me ordering by the third dish otherwise I would still be there eating now! I liked this place very much and will return to try other dishes. But my main mission will be to find people who have a stomach for the more adventurous side of the menu. Really want to try their intestines, hope it's like how my father used to make them. So many dishes to try! Just happy this place is so nearby and to think I have been searching for so long! 

Prices are a little on the steep side but I have to come to terms with that when it comes to Chinese food unless you get a greasy noodle box from some public transport station, but that is a whole different ball game!

Oh I should also mention they have an impressive selection of craft beers too!"

b"This restaurant is a little out of the way but totally worth the trek. The food is very good and the service is wonderful. If you're unsure, the front part of the menu has photos of each item to help with your decision. If you want good Chinese food while in Berlin, Da Jia Le is worth a stop."

b'I've bookmarked this for the longest time, and finally, I got the chance to get here. Oh, how wonderful!

It's always a joy to find a Chinese restaurant that doesn't tailor its cuisine to the "needs" of the local population. Hence, when I was living in the US, I always sought these little hole in the wall Chinese restaurants because I didn't really dig General Tso's Chicken. And so here in Berlin, I am glad to have found this.

One tip: if you ever try and eat here, don't order from the menu that has no pictures. Order from the menu that has pictures. The picture-less menu is your standard Chinese fare that you would expect every Chinese restaurant would carry. But the menu with the pictures, those are the bomb!

We ordered three dishes which we shared between the two of us. We ordered the beef tripe (D03), the seaweed salad (D12), and the pork belly stewed in tomatoes with glass noodles (D33). All the dishes were amazing!

And surprisingly, they also have quite a good selection of German craft beers, which definitely work well with the hot dishes that they have!

I would definitely try to be back here when I can. But first I'll try to exercise and burn away this meal I ate.'

b'Wow, this is a great chinese restaurant. Already when you enter the restaurant you somehow feel you are in China. The decor is a bit tacky and the place itself has a very large dining room with a lot of tables. The food is really great, I would rate it as the best Chinese food I had in Berlin. We went for the cold potato salad and the squid for starters, both excellent. For mains we had some steamed fish and fried sweet and sour pork. The dishes were just excellent and on top of all this great food this place also has a craft beer list that matches some fancy bars in Berlin. A full thumbs up in every aspect.'

b'I like the food here. You can choose between the western Chinese style or the transitional style. Both of them taste good for me. \n\nDas Essen schmeckt mir gut. Mann kann zwischen der westlichen chinesischen Art und der traditionellen chinesischen Art ausw\xc3\xa4hlen. Beide gefallen mir. Lecker. :)'

b"After living in Beijing for almost 4 years then moving to Berlin 2.5 years ago I've been craving REAL Chinese food and I'm very pleased to say I've found it! 

Authentic dishes,  superb flavours and very nice staff (they even kindly put up with my terrible out of practice Chinese!). Another delightful surprise was the great selection of craft beers on their menu BONUS! But I stayed faithful and had a Tsingtao to truly have my \xe7\x9c\x9f Chinese fix. 

Do yourself a favour and go eat some real Chinese food,  you will not regret it."
b'The food was really good and the service was great! My favourites were duck with shrimps and for desert the caramelised sweetpotatoes!\nWonderful!'

b"Probably some of the best Chinese I've had in Berlin... I can't say I've tried every place but everything I ordered was really fresh and tasty. The portions were actually quite large as well so you get your money's worth!\n\nAlso they have some local craft beer selections which is a plus!"

b'Last time I tried the Sichuan-style chicken, which blew me away. I needed to give them one more star just for that dish.\n\nI asked them about Hunan food in Berlin and they recommended another place not too far away which I tried, too.'

b'Food: Authentic, delicious, and freshest ingredients. 
Drinks: Selected craft beers and top notch wines for an affordable price.
Service: Run by a sweet and friendly family.
Perfection!'

b"I ate here last week and had a really delicious meal.  The restaurant is in a kind of odd location - just down from the Yorkstrasse station in an area of mostly apartment buildings and sp\xc3\xa4ti.  It took us a second to figure out how to get inside the restaurant...turns out there are sliding doors on the right!  The interior is nothing special, just the typical Chinese restaurant stuff, but it was quiet and the booths felt intimate. 

The menu is quite large!  I had difficulty picking something out from all of the options.  Eventually we settled on a chicken and a pork dish (I don't remember the names because they were Chinese!) and some pork & shrimp dim sum.  Both of our dishes were awesome!  Especially the pork, which was cut into very thing strips like straws.  The dim sum was very good but it took a loooong time to come out; we had nearly finished our entrees before it was delivered. 

One cool thing about this place is that they serve craft beer!  I was impressed with the beer selection and, although I opted for a Rollberg on draft this time, was excited to see so many unique options. 

All in all, it was really nice and I would definitely go back!"
b'One thing for sure. Check their fish menu! Everything is the next-door-girl but their Fish is a diva.'

b'This place is incredible! I live only 2 blocks away and just discovered the place! The waitress was super friendly and the food was exceptional! \nI never write reviews on Yelp, but This place was too good for me not to. \nIf you want delicious authentic Chinese food with big portions, this is the place to GO!'
b'Good authentic Chinese food, rare to find like this in berlin.'

b"Going back and forth between a 4.5-5 only because they forgot our order of noodles & thus it came out way too late..

Food is spectacular, mostly referring to their Spicy Tofu dish with Rice for 9.50. 
10 Dumplings for 6.50 isn't the greatest, so you can skip on that unless you are in a party of 5-6. 

I will have to come back for the spicy tofu."

b"Wow, I did not expect this at all. First, best Chinese food (non-dim sum category) I've found in Europe. Spicy, tasty, and a diverse selection of dishes that go way beyond the typical Asia Box imbiss menu of X with noodles, Y with noodles, X with rice, Y with rice, etc. The menu is divided into two parts -- the first includes pictures of each dish and is mehr oder weniger the best part. Lots going on here, with a wide variety of Chinese regional cooking, and even some (Russian, Indian) borrowed from neighboring countries. The second half of the menu is the more traditional set of Chinese dishes you'd expect to find in a Chinese restaurant anywhere in the West. We tried beef with cumin spice, a whole fish with five-spice flavored sauce, szechuan pepper flavored shoestring potatoes (very spicy!), and a spicy cucumber salad. Service was nice and helpful, and while I little spartan, the restaurant was clean. 

So, we'd have been pretty with all of that, but then, wow again, somehow this modest little chinese restaurant just happens to have the best, most affordable, and most diverse craft beer selection in Berlin!  Really. A few American imports, Belgians, and German microbrews.  Flat German pilsners are rarely good matches for spicy food, and wheat beers and rice are a poor match as well, which is why I was so geeked to see hoppy and flavorable beers on the menu here that could stand up to chili peppers and other strong spices.

We were less than halfway through our meal and already trying to figure out how soon we could come back without it being awkward."

b"A cuisine influenced by Russia, Korea, and China? Just wow! Their seaweed salad is to die for. Their soups and stews are hearty and perfect for Berlin's awful winters. Kimchi lovers you may have a religious experience. Warning: their Szechuan dishes are properly spiced (very, very, spicy). I'm a regular and with every visit am discovering new flavors. In my opinion this is one of Berlin's most interesting restaurants. My only complaint is they don't currently take credit cards."

b"I hesitate to review this largely undiscovered gem, because if more people knew how amazing the food is, this place would be packed. But hell, they deserve the business. 

Occupying a space that was once an industrial laundry, and decorated a bit like a suburban hotel lobby, Da Jia Le is very much the opposite of a trendy hipster hangout. Whatever. It's all about the food. Order off the menu of Northeastern Chinese regional specialties (the section with the photos), many of which are unlike anything else you'll find in Berlin. The spicy dishes are not only truly, properly spicy - they're wonderfully fragrant and well-balanced, with very generous portions. The Sichuan Pork in Chili Broth is probably my favorite, and one order (13.50) is big enough for several people. The meat menu doesn't shy away from offal and bones (the stuff of real Chinese food) and the vegetable and tofu dishes are sensational too, especially the eggplant. 

Every time I've been, the service was incredibly friendly and professional, making the experience all the nicer. But it would be really nice if this place delivered too; the location isn't in the most lively spot for a night out."

b"We've eaten Chinese in lots of place around the world and this ranks easily in the top 3. My wife had gong pao chicken and I had the fried black pepper beef; both were superb. Veggies sweet and crunchy, meat cooked to perfection. We also has an order of baked shrimp crackers--marvelous. 

And the service was attentive and efficient and very prompt. Perhaps prompted by reviews here, waiter told us tip was not included.

Highly recommended."

b"I give this place a solid 4 stars. I went to this spot during their lunch hours so I was able to order from their lunch menu. The prices were super reasonable with their lunch menu. Each person's meal ranged from 7 to 10 euros. \n\nI ordered their fried tofu. As far as my drink, I opted for their rose blossom tea. I recommend both of these options for lunch. In total I paid about 12 euros for my drink and lunch. The fried tofu is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The sauce is kind of salty. Thus, I would have wanted more rice. I suggest you order an extra bowl of rice to counter the salty level of the tofu dish."
b'Wow! Good food and service- actually some of the best we found in Berlin. Vegetable options, English and German menus, high quality food. Highly recommend.'
b"OK food, but terrible service! Wait forever to get my check. Be careful, they'll secretly add tips on your bill."

b"They don't actually stay open as late as they say. Hours aren't accurate. We arrived a half hour before the listed closing time, and we weren't allowed to be seated. Despite telling him that his hours posted on the door indicate the restaurant is open, we were turned away. Don't waste your time."

b"I had such high hopes due to all the great reviews. And I got disappointed. Had a soso honey pork dish which really didn't flash me at all. The sugar peas where rather spare and overall the dish was pretty bland. Bummer!"

b"I only order one thing , but it's not good\nThere's Expensive meal but using cheaper material, the yuxiang shredded pork should with carrots but they are using bean sprouts which maybe cheaper and really minimum agaric I only can find three piece in the meal, does make this meal really not good, I don't think I will come back again"

b"Delicious Chinese in Berlin. We had the dim sum and jelly fish for starters, then the kung pao chicken and duck for our main courses and the green tea with toasted rice to drink. All of it was very good, though we'll order it spicier next time. Highly recommended!"

b"The ubiquity of Chinese restaurants in every town I've been to dulls the senses a little towards what's going to be eaten. This place woke up my taste buds with dishes that were traditional but still new to me. It helped that I visited with some Chinese friends who ordered without really looking at the menu. I won't attempt to make any recommendations but needless to say everything we are was top notch and at a reasonable price. Recommended."

b'I was seated quickly and the meal was brought about 5 minutes after ordering.  Had the sweet and sour chicken.  It was served different than what I am used to, but I enjoyed it.  Price was around 12 euros. Berliner tap beer was cold and awesome.\n\nThe waiters did disappear for 45 minutes and I had trouble getting the bill.'

b"This is a really good Chinese place in Berlin. We had a variety of dishes, and all of them were very good. I'm 1/2 Chinese. The Peking Duck was actually quite authentic, contrary to some reviews, and the Bok Choy, Hong Shao Qie Zi (\xe7\xba\xa2\xe7\x83\xa7\xe8\x8c\x84\xe5\xad\x90\xef\xbc\x9bsoy sauce braised eggplant), and Kung Pao Chicken were all fantastic. The service was good as well. They have English menus upon request. Free shot of plum wine at the end of the meal was nice. I'd definitely come back here."

b"The food here is good, and they have a special menu for the hot summer, but the service is strange, and I feel bewildered and neglected. Maybe I'm too accustomed to dining in the US, I just wished when I sat down, someone could come over and ask me what I'd like to drink. But the waiter just left me with a menu and left. It took some time and work to get their attention when I wanted to order. \n\nMoreover, tips are included in the total amount on my bill, which my German friend told me is unusual and never heard of in Germany."

b"Tried this place last night because of briefly reading a few reviews and I was not impressed. Being on Chinese decent living in Vancouver Canada where we been told we have the best Chinese food outside of China. This place was a disappointment and I hate to say the worst Chinese food I have ever had. We had a few starters soup, dumplings, fried noodles etc. which was different I was jot impressed. Waiting for our main coarse Peking duck to arrive I was hopeful and excited by saying they can't mess this up unless they change the sauce... They did instead of the classic housin sauce I Dunno what they gave us but left a chalky aftertaste. Bill came to 76 Euros!\n\nMaybe my standards are high being from where I'm from but sorry this place is terrible. Don't say you haven't been warned."

b"It's one of those places made me wish there were more stars on Yelp reviews. Looks like a regular chinese place, but it's a gem. We tried lamb (don't know name showed picture in Yelp to order), duck with peanut souce, seaweed salad and dumplings. All excellent. Haven't eaten that good chinese in ages. Staff is nice and place is big and spacious too. They suggested wine with our food (no kidding), and I was surprised how it complimented food.\n\nPS to bad mouthing chinese: Yeah you can eat better chinese in China. Too bad it's a trillion hour flight."

b"One of the best Chinese joints I've been to in Europe.

Dirt cheap and the food is great. The menu is authentic and bountiful including very good dim sum, szechuan specialties and of course Peking duck with pancakes.

The duck was fairly moist and crispy. Everything else was fantastic. The eggplant in chili oil and garlic with cilantro was dreamy.

I wanted to order the entire menu and actually look forward to going back next time I'm in Berlin!!

Unfortunately, the service sucked, otherwise it would have deserved 5 stars!"

b'this is probably the worst restaurant i've ever been to, anywhere in the world. this includes the taco bell that consistently made me sick as a kid....

i've been in europe for almost 3 weeks now and was craving some chinese food, so found this place on yelp with 4 stars and 150 reviews, so figured it was a solid pick. we get there and are seated instantly (although we didnt have reservations, b/c they asked lol). it took a few minutes for our waitress but got drinks and food on order and waited. 

first up, XLB, because i have to eat XLB anywhere it is served (who doesn't?!). XLB was good but not soupy, but hey, it's germany, not shanghai or NYC. 

our entrees arrived and it's a bit weird. i ordered "crispy fried chicken with sweet and sour sauce." what i got was a fillet of fried chicken cut up, and then on top of it, another fillet of sesame encrusted chicken, also cut up. ok, that's cool i guess. then i get a bowl of sweet and sour sauce. 

this whole time, there's some fruit flies around, but when i pour out soy sauce (luckily on my plate b/c i wasn't sure if it was vinegar) there were *several* dead flies in it! holy smokes! my parents are with me and now aghast. the waitress that i told was like "oh, yeah, ok ill get you a new one." seems this is a known issue...

my dad got crispy duck and noted that it wasn't good, like it had been reheated. after leaving and reading additional reviews it seems we're not alone in that thinking. 

we got our check and left, but noted they added service on the bill of around 8%. i spend quite a bit of time in europe and i've only seen that at high end places, not places like this. no one on the team ever asked how the meal was or seemed concerned we barely ate anything. quite a horrible experience.'

b"Extremely unfriendly waiters. We sat down on the terrace and they tried to move us to another table because they didn't want to walk the extra couple of meters to serve us. When we said we prefer to stay at that table they said we need to move because of our pram with our one month old daughter (sleeping by the way, so no annoying crying etc) was in the way. We just left."
b"Food was absolutely disgusting. Greasy, bland, and came out cold. Also, their staff were some of the rudest servers I've ever encountered. Save your money and time and go somewhere else."

b"Food was extremely salty. I'm not usually one to make a fuss, but I had to send my mapo tofu back. I could not eat more than a spoonful. When I told the server I wanted to cancel my order (not replace it) he reacted with a confused frowning face saying 'I tasted it, it's not salty. It's normal '. At least when I reiterated that it was in fact salty and I didn't want it he took it away and I wasn't charged for it. I was however shocked to see that they had added a tip to our bill (around 10% if I remember right). I have not seen this so far anywhere else in my two weeks here in Berlin. This includes more upscale establishments and restaurants serving us as a party of 10 or more (we were only 4 at peking ente).\n\nAs I side note, I understand that bottled water is part of the culture in Europe. But stating explicitly that you don't serve tap water and making the food this salty seems a big suspect."

b"5 stars??!!  Really?!  This place is overpriced and sub par.  \nWhile visiting berlin we relied in this restaurant's stellar yelp reviews to make a dinner choice. If this is the best that Berlin has to offer, I suggest replacing all meals with bread and beer. We specifically ordered the specialties of the house in order to get the most authentic experience possible. The meal was just the opposite.  The soup and dumplings were good but nothing to write home about. The perch was over salty and totally overpowered by it's heavy brown sauce, the sweet and sour chicken was lightly breaded but the sauce was equivalent any US takeout, ditto for the roast At 32 euros The Peking duck was a rip off so we didn't even bother. The interior was a little better than average but the neighborhood and building looked like the ghetto."
b"I thought our two dishes were great.  Highly recommend the mapo dofu and the yu-hsiang eggplant.  Both were seasoned perfectly.  I can't wait to go back."

b"We've been here second time. First time we had Beijing duck and got quite unsatisfied with it, because it's not close to what you get in China. After a while we tried again today and chose some more typical Hunan style food. We should have learned from the first time being here: The vegetable was overcooked, I couldn't finish the meat because of the too strong seasoning. So the food was far below what you would expect from a better Chinese restaurant. Normally at least we would have eaten something, but here it was almost not possible.\nThe waiters are very friendly and the interior is a bit cool but looks clean. Since there are quite a few nice Chinese restaurants in Berlin, we can't recommend this one so far and won't give it a third chance."

b'I thought the food was mediocre.  We ordered many dishes and everyone was underwhelmed.  We expected more based on all the good reviews.  Compared to Chinese restaurants in NYC, San Francisco and Los Angeles our meal in Berlin was a disappointment.'

b'The place has ENGLISH MENUS!\n\nThe english menus made it quite easy to order and made the restaurant feel much more welcoming. The food itself was quite good, especially the Gung Bao Chicken. The service was quite fast as well by Berlin/European standards!'

b'Outside of Vietnamese and sushi, Asian food in Berlin is often disappointing.  So when I came across glowing reviews for this restaurant on another site frequented by Germans I was cautiously hopeful - even though it is located in the middle of tourist-trap hell.

Thankfully that optimism held true.  The SO and I shared a Sichaun Menu for 2 that included Fried Prawns, deep fried duck, Gong Bau Chicken, and baked pork in sweet and sour sauce - all for 32 euro.  On the whole the food was very good, with the strongest dish being the chicken, which was fresh and nicely sauced, and the weakest being the pork, which was the only dish we did not finish.  But even the pork was better than average, with a sauce that was not the usual sweet goop too often found in Chinese restaurants but rather a more complicated citrusy one that allowed the pork room of its own to be tasted.

It should be noted that the SO and I both agreed that we enjoyed the meal, but would not have that particular menu again.  So why the four stars?  Well at least one of the stars is for the tea we drank.  They have a selection of more exotic Chinese teas available by the pot - we had Jasmine flower-ball (which is literally a Jasmine flower inside a clear pot - cool and tasty) and green-tea with roasted rice which is really excellent - almost a more masculine tea that comes across as somewhat smokey and yes, a bit ricey (in a good way!)

This is a restaurant I will return to because the menu holds a great deal of promise.  The dim sum choices, for example, look above average and they offer a Chinese fondue that sounds excellent.  When I go back, however, I will not make the same mistake we did tonight, arriving without reservations to a packed restaurant.  We were lucky we got in as they turned a number of larger parties away out-right.  Clearly Berliners have discovered this and I am glad I finally stumbled onto it as well...'

b"Avoid. 

---
The interior could be nice'ish - the surroundings are an old university student concrete slab desolate 'ghetto', as another reviewer commented. I would like to write we ate there, as this is supposed to be such a place...

..but i can't! [Head to Meli's instead.]

We glanced at a few reviews, and were mostly mesmerized at 4,5 stars and 79 reviews. { Ahem... after closer inspection the supposedly 'Deep Thought' engine sorting and dismissing 'irrelevant' reviews, is including five-year old reviews.. which are no longer accurate.}

And so we set to go, and then after, to westberlin cafe, just finished dropping someone off near mendelson ubahn (u2), hungry and exploring. 'Two stations then excellent chinese food', we thought.

After getting there, it looked completely empty. _Empty_. From The entry, looking to the left, away and in the corner - not the 'best' views, had no reserved sign - neither the tables around it. Approaching the waiter's station, i noticed about half of the tables reserved, and.. eventually i was told, after several minutes of waiting, that it would be 'just a moment', and then the same in deutsch. Something felt odd or strange about that, sterile and disconnected. Cold. My appetite slightly sank for their food.

Some moments later, i was immediately asked 'zwei person' officiously, not at all relaxed, warm or friendly, and then was immediately told 'alles reserviert' - everything is reserved.

The manner was so crass, that i didn't even feel like carryout or have any appetite for their food, and just left, telling my girl in an amazed voice that, 'she said everything was reserved!' She was already seated at the non-reserved 'reserved' table, eagerly anticipating a menu which would never arrive.

Aware of the excuses we could make for them, such as 'not enough reserved' signs since the wall came down, i'm going with the feeling on this one - something just ain't right.

We went to Meli's instead; laid-back friendly service, nice background not-too-loud music, casual. Friedrichstr. 204. Hope to leave a review if there isn't one already.

Onto westberlin next!"

b'The classic, classic Chinese restaurant you\'d find or should find in any "ChinaTown" around the world. I tried the typical Sweet & Sour Chicken with Pork Fried Rice, she tried a "custom" dish by request - tofu, chicken, prawns in a spicy sauce with garlic. Both brought tasteful smiles. The most fabulous, however, was the mango sorbet served - so good, it may as well have been the fruit itself!'

b'Good authentic mainland (Peking and Sichuan, not Hong Kong/Cantonese) Chinese food. Nice simple decor, good service and you get proper Chinese home-cooked food in Germany (which is a long way from China).\nPrices are not the cheapest but it is not at all expensive for what you get and what you get is pretty well fed. The Peking Duck is only 35 EUR for 2 persons, which cannot be considered very expensive, though it is not terribly authentic either. But one can see it is indeed home-cooked and full points for the effort.\nBut overall, it is really best to stick only with the Sichuan dishes, like the lamb cooked in dried herbs. That was really quite yummy!'

b"I was looking forward to trying this place out because of the high ratings here, but found the food quite terrible. The quality of the Chinese food was that of an 8 euro buffet, while we paid 32 euros for our sichuan meal (not including drinks). Perhaps they have better items on the menu, but after trying four dishes ranging from mediocre to awful, we won't be giving them another shot."

b"Just went today for lunch with my girlfriend.
We ordered two dishes :
Ente Gebraten mit gemuese ( backed Duck with vegetables) and
ente gebraten mit scharfe sauce ( duck with hot sauce).
Both they came with a nice-standard soup.
When the duck is arrived we were a bit disappointed.
The quality is middle, the duck is not so crispy and fresh, and the sauce it's quite poor in taste and choose of ingredients.
We know very well how a good grill Chinese Duck should taste, after years living in Chinatown in london and after trying loads of chinese restaurants in Bangkok. 
Peking Mitte is a sufficient quality duck restaurant, at an affordable price.
nothing more, especially after reading the 5 stars review from loads of german people here on qype.
Good thing is service and drinks are really bargain (2 EUR for a 0.3 coke), but we don't go to restaurant for drinks, we go for tasting good food!"

b"Very good, authentic food, friendly service. It's nice to sit ouside with good weather, fortunately there is not much traffic on Wilhelmstrasse.
My favourite dish: Beijing style noodles (spaghetti Beijing)
The lovely book collection of Ms Tang invites to stay a bit longer. According to German magazine Der 
Spiegel the favourite restaurant of pianist Lang Lang when he is in Berlin."

b"It was our first time there, the service was kind and the food was very
very tasty. The Peking duck was Ok, but not the best one I had. All the other dishes though were excelent. 
 For me the whole evening was ruined by the hostess. She was kind of
unfriendly and told me to keep my kid (2Y) quiet because die andere
G\xc3\xa4ste nicht begeistert sind . I suppose
she was right about that, but I am also sure that there are friendy ways to say that to a guest. So we won't go there again. At least not until
our kids are 18 :-)."
b'This is the best Chinese place I have eaten at in Berlin.  The Peking Duck tastes authentic and everything else was a big step above what normally passes for Chinese food in Berlin...'

b'Service: top.
Lage: top.
Einrichtung: interessant ;)
Essen: fantastisch.
Sowohl die Ente als auch das Rind waren wirklich sehr sehr gut, ausgewogen und vor allem auch ohne Glutamat. Die dim sum schmeckten hervorragend.
Besonders empfehlenswert ist der Jasminblumen-Tee, schmeckt super und ist auch was f\xc3\xbcrs Auge.
Sogar der Wein war klasse, was nicht immer gegeben ist. Wir kommen sicher wieder. Preis-Leistung ist unschlagbar.'

b'Pretty good real Chinese restaurant.


 Nice menu with lots to choose from.


 Patio where you can sit outside, but inside is also nice. Service always friendly. Parking places in front of the door.


 Great value for money, especially the business lunches in the afternoon when you get a soup plus main course for about 6 euro!


 Food is a bit on the fat and salty side though too bad !'

b'I visited this restaurant earlier this week after reading about it on QYPE. Very interesting menu which has much different choices from the norm.
I had the most lovely cold starter which is sliced pork with a multitude of dressing and flavours- nice. The main course of prawns was also excellent and very well presented.
The service was also very attentive and friendly. Hmm nice Berliner Pilsner also served here too.
Overall, i really enjoyed the meal, and much thanks to the owners who gave me directions through QYPE'

b'If you have never been in China before and tasted real Chinese food you might be surprised or even disappointed, but give it a try then without thinking about the typical Chinese you find in Europe or the USA. Close your eyes, order what the lovely service recommends and taste thinking you try something completely new...and you might love it! It comes pretty close to the real phantastic Chinese kitchen, but has only few similarities to the glutamate Chinese...good, recommended, it even looks close to a real Chinese resto, pretty uninspired and cold, but hey it is close to real and the service is really lovely! Enjoy'

b"This restaurant has some dishes I haven't seen on other Chinese restaurant menus anywhere. The food is excellent. The pork with bean sauce and Peking Doilies is particularly good. In addition to street parking, there is a small parking lot right beside the restaurant and other shops in that strip. I have been to Chinese restaurants in many places in the US, Mexico, Germany, Norway and even Turkey and this is one of the best."

b"friendly service, good menu selection, food is tasty and reasonably priced. nice neighborhood place to go to for Chinese food. only gripe is that the ventilation could be improved so that one does not leave with one's clothes smelling like food"

b"I joked that this is the place in Berlin where all the veggies go. People crow about the duck here, but the veg red curry and clay pot were both amazing. Full of a wide variety of veggies, really fantastic flavors, silky tofu. Never thought I'd love Thai curry at a Chinese place but the red curry was excellent. Bay Area, CA born and raised so I'm used to both cuisines, in their restaurant form. Spice level is decent if slightly dumbed down for the northern EU taste. This was the only place we ate in a Berlin that I could see myself returning to regularly. Really quite lovely. Oh. And FAST."

b'When you visit an Asian restaurant and you are the only non Asians eating...you know you are eating at the right place. Great atmosphere, good location and amazing food. We had the dinner for two and it was extremely filling... could have been for three or four light eaters. We left a lot of food. If your looking for not Chinese not Thai not Japanese... but something like it... this Asian hits the spot!'

b'Good Asian food for Berlin, good Asian food period. German food is sorely lacking in spices and after a week of wursts and potatoes, s schezuan  kick to the  stomach was very welcome. Great atmosphere and friendly service. Dim sum even, not half bad.'

b"We had a lovely dinner at Restaurant Jolly! 
The interior was like a fine dining restaurant.
It was kind of funny how they had candlelit dinner tables with a romantic setting and people were chowing down with their chopsticks and rice bowls haha.
We came here as they are famous for their peking duck. It was really good! 
We were starved after a full day of touring around Berlin and finished the day off dining here. 
Service was excellent.

I'd recommend the:
* Sweet & sour soup
* Peking duck
* Stir-fry veggies

Also, a note to travellers.. they have free wifi! :D"
b'Really delicious food. Big portions. Great atmosphere. Overall, would certainly recommend.'

b'As an Chinese American, this restaurant seemed to have treated me like some disowned family member. Almost no attention was given to me.  I was given a small corner table while the German/white customers got the roomy tables - even for 2
Person groups. 

The hot and sour soup has a TOMATO base!  Definitely not authentic.  

The Jolly tofu pot was passable.  Interestingly used spam.  No shrimp. 

On the positive side, the tables and chairs and whole ambiance was good.  Just that they have some sort of reverse discrimination.  

If you r Asian, u know what to expect. Not fully authentic Chinese food and possible poor treatment.'

b'I went tonight with a group of 10... (We where here for the Berlin film festival. )  .. Amazing food. We had Duck, eggplant, more duck, Beef with veggies, fish with veggies, Duck, rice,  Dumplings, chicken... The best tasting Chinese food.. We loved it.... Best spot in Berlin... A+  A  recommend.. Get the duck lol... (Tea, the sesame balls, wine, etc... I will be back.'

b"A really good choice for Asian food in Berlin. \nThe food is very tasteful and staff is super nice and helpful. The dishes are enormous. We were 4 people  and didn't manage to finish more than half of the food, so a tip would be to perhaps start with one dish to share (if couple) - then add another one if still hungry.. Or have starters before sharing."

b'A good variety of Asian regional food grouping. All items on the menu where good portions and rich on flavors. Still an authentic place that keeps some traditions in place. Certainly a place to repeat!'

b'I went on a Wednesday afternoon at 12:30 and the place was not packed at all. Amazing value and great atmosphere. I ordered the lunch special with duck and noodles for around 8 euro. It was delicious!'

b"I would have never imagined that I would I'd end up having Chinese food in Berlin!  In any case, after a long day of touring Museuminsel on a chilly spring day, this was the closest restaurant to the island we could find, so we figured to give it a try. It ended up being a good decision!

Being Chinese, I think I can validate the authenticity of its food. We especially loved the dim sum choices that were offered as part of the menu. After weeks of traveling in Europe, this was my first taste of home! For less than \xe2\x82\xac30, we had quite a feast for two!

The restaurant was surprisingly crowded on a weekday night. There was a mix of tourists and German business people. I'm taking a star off for its ridiculously slow service and lack of menus. The table next to us waited literally 20 minutes to get a menu! And we waited just about the same time to put down our order. The friendliness of the waiters and manager made up for the slow service in the end, though."

b"This restaurant is a must-try! I have never before had authentic Chinese food outside of China - until I went to Jolly! 
A little expensive but great food. 

I had dinner here with my boyfriend to celebrate an anniversary. We met in China, so we decided to have Chinese food. We ordered the roasted duck with prawns and vegetables, beef with black pepper and silk tofu. All dishes were great! I would probably order duck without prawns next time though since they didn't taste much, or try the Peking duck!"

b'We (2ppl) ordered the set menu for two, a bottle of water, two large beers and a small beer all together at 43 \xe2\x82\xac. the set was as a whole very delicious and highly recommended. the servings and the pacing between dishes was good. I usually eat a lot and was skeptical there would be enough food to fill my appetite--there was, and with leftovers! The ambient is calm and stylish. 

The set included:
-sweet and sour soup
-4 egg rolls
-the main dishes (breaded duck and beef stir fried) served on the same platter and with a large bowl of rice
-vanilla ice cream with deep-fried bananas'

b"Solid Chinese food. All that's missing are some more pork dishes, such as some crispy belly ;)

Their Peking Duck is the thing to go for, but everything else I tried over a few visits were all good. For Chinese in Berlin, very good even. 

Efficient service too and nice to be able to look into the kitchen."

b'Amazing crispy duck and dim sum. My partners soup was good as well. Nice ambiance and friendly service. The duck was enormous, easily enough for two with appetizers. Two drinks, two apps and a main course came to 32 euro. Well worth it!!'

b"Possibly one the best... neigh, thee greatest Asian food I've had in Europe, would honestly consider a trip back to Berlin just to eat here. The sweet and sour duck with lychee was amazing, along with the duck curry, and fried noodle with chicken, top tier. Duck game strong tho. Would recommend again and again."
b'Great food and nice place, staff looked very bored though.'
b'A little expensive for value for money but the atmosphere is nice and the food was very tasty. Compared to the typical tourist traps around this area Jolly is definitely a better option.'

b"We had a long day of walking with the family and landed in the restaurant by chance. By LUCK I should say. The food was delicious and the service was very kind. Will definitely come back and would recommend. Every course and choice was better than the one before.\nMy regards and a 'great job!' To the chef!"

b'Let me say right off I think this place is 3 1/2 stars.

After hours and hours spent on museum island we needed a bite to refresh and renew ourselves.  It was raining, (Berlin in July!  got to love it) and this place is right across from Pergamon so it won.  The idea of having late afternoon dim sum sounded good.  However, as I've come to learn dim sum in Germany does not mean the same thing as in Hong Kong or the states.  Basically, they had 4 or 5 different dumplings you can order, but not traditional dim sum with a variety of small bites.  That is fine, just something to know up front if you are expecting little carts rolling around with lovely treats on them or a menu of small bites and some tea.  

We ened up getting a "mixed sampler" of dumplings plus a sea food lemon grass soup.  The sampler of dumplings had 2 dumplings of four different types.  To be honest, only the veggie one was memorable.  The rest were fine, but nothing special, but again I have high standards when it comes to dumplings and such, but lets say I wasn't impressed.  The soup however was very good.  It was spicy, the seafood was excellent, and it was almost like a laksa.  I would vote this soup as a good hangover cure or jet lag cure.  A bowl of spicy good things.  IT was actually perfect for a raining afternoon.  This soup is what is getting them closer to four stars in my book.  

So I would give this place another try and try out a few other things but I was not impressed with how the duck looked.  But service was very good, and on a rainy afternoon a good place to get some spicy soup.'

b'I work for a German company and come to Berlin a few times each year. I found this place years ago on my first visit after leaving tired and hungry from the Pergamom. It is now a "regular" place for me. The service is good, the food is good (I recommend the dim sum or duck soup), they recognized me as needing chopsticks immediately because I knew how to order (San Francisco trains one well). I have brought Chinese colleagues who find very authentic dishes on the menu and have expanded my repertoire (the cold chicken is also excellent). My only complaint is that there are few vegetables. Perhaps it is difficult to find Gai Lan or sugar pea shoots in Germany? But I think they could find something to saut\xc3\xa9ed in a little garlic or toss with some oyster sauce to make sure the meal is more balanced...still. You should go. It\'s well worth it.'
b'Second time here in a week. GREAT food. Try the potstickers and curry items. Great service. No disappointment.'

b'My husband and I stopped in here for a late dinner and were seated quickly. I had the noodles with vegetables and cashews which was quite tasty. Not too oily, and I was able to add my own spices. My husband had the 8 piece mix of dim sum and he scarfed them down. He only wished he order the 10 piece, since it was so good. Great service and a friendly, local vibe.'
b"The Peking duck is so good, it's a must at restaurant Jolly. The noodles with vegetables and cashews is great too! Everything was freshly prepared and delicious!"

b"Food was fresh and good. Service just average, had to ask for water refills several times. Relaxed service, they're in no rush to take your order or bring your check, which is nice. Great atmosphere, warm and inviting and easy to have a good conversation with low noise level."

b"Jolly is a bit hidden behind the museums. We tried this one several times and always had a good time there. The service is friendly, the interior design is modern and clean. The Dim Sum are fresh and worth trying and they dare to serve dishes in there original spiciness. Shui zu niu rou is recommendable, also the pork belly. Didn't try the desserts yet, but we will come back to try some more of their dishes. Prices are not cheap but match the quality. For me it's in the league of the best 5 chinese restaurants in Berlin.\nNow we've been there many times and the first time we've been dissatisfied when trying their most expensive dish, the peking duck., the first time. It didn't look at all like the photos within the menu and was just one piece of duck skin, the rest just normal duck meat. When asked about the reasons for that change, they didn't say sorry but tried to convince us, that this is normal peking duck style, which obviously is not. Even the skin color was just light brown instead of the crunchy dark brown normal style. For a price of 19 euro this is not acceptable and we told them. No sorry, no discount, no free drink, no attempt to solve the situation. For that price level they should be prepared better for complaints and should handle them better and transparent. We won't come back after this experience."

b'Our first night in Berlin and we chose well, the service and food were first class the Peking duck was the best I have ever had, and the main was plentiful, I could not finish it, and all at a very fair price'

b"Amazing restaurant! Service is really fast, very nice and doesn't mess up ;) The food is some of the best I've had outside of Asia, and it's quite cheap for that quality. Try the dim sum and anything from the duck."

b"This is difficult for me to admit, but yes-I am a closet yelper. I have rarely been satisfied enough by my meal to consider cracking open the door of repression and sharing my experiences with others, and lesser times yet without the influence of alcohol, but the meal I enjoyed at this restaurant tonight is worth sober-waving a rainbow colored (or whatever series of colors yelp lurkers are represented by) flag for. 

I am a cheap person and was delighted to find reasonably priced food. You can expect to pay about 10 euros per person if you only order entrees. My wife and I consumed our meal family buffet style, which this restaurant is really made for.

If you're timid and may be concerned about ordering authentic Chinese, there is no need to be here. The menu is spelled out in a few languages, including English, and every dish also has its picture next to it. Better yet, the food that comes out actually looks like the picture! They have the typical Chinese dishes (i.e.  sweet and sour chicken) for you to fall back on if cat tongue or whatever (they don't actually serve cat tongue... On the menu anyways. If they did I would consider getting it because everything looks delicious) doesn't quite do it for your palette. 

We had the sweet and sour chicken as well as the double fried pork, both of which were great. It was nice to be able to flip back and forth between a sweet and a savory dish. Most items like our chicken or pork also come with white rice. There are other options in back of the menu (noodles, fried rice) that are served as a stand alone dish. 

The service was quick, something I haven't experienced in Europe yet either. They have a more secluded section then another section that houses a ~60 inch TV. They adjusted the volume according to our preference and we watched Mulan a couple of times. Just kidding, it was some soccer match. 

Although I didn't receive a fortune cookie to tell me that sunshine is a ray of hope or that new friends are just around the corner, I was impressed enough to creep out of the bowels of my dark hole, break the silence, share my feelings, cover myself with feathers, lead the parade, and wave the flag for Lao Xiang."
b'We enjoyed the cold wood ear salad/ fish congee/ pork buns/ cumin lamb. Cool atmosphere'

b'3* is for the nice staff.  Food really is disappointing.  Not quality ingredients & uses cheap substitutes.  Dishes came out different than in the menu pictures.  We have a Chinese speaking Chinese talking to the waitress & hoping the food we ordered will be "for Chinese".  Disappointed it came out still "European" Chinese food.  Using the wrong ingredients just didn\'t bring the right tastes.  \n\nStaff is nice, presentation of the food is nice.  But I wish it had more good taste than looks.'

b"Do try the double fried pork, it's slightly spicy and amazing. Its not like anything you've tried before!\nOf course if you feel like eating chicken or frog legs, oyster or octopus Lao Xiang is the place for all of them.\nThe place is quite big, has even a private golden room and the service is nice."

b"to be honest, Chinese food is not my most favourite cuisine but I simply love this restaurant. I fell in love with their visually magnificent menu cards. and the food is terrific. I'm so lucky it's right next to the corner of my flat that I could come as much as I want."
b"Great authentic Chinese food. Also try the hotpot which is actually not on the menu. Random funny note: The Xi'an warrior near to the bathroom is holding a Germany flag - not sure why."

b'We had a great experience in this place located next to the train station in Prenzlauer Berg. The prices are quite inexpensive. Service is very attentive and dedicated. Portions are quite big. Food is quite tasty and the menu is quiet big. Maybe not the most authentic Chinese food that you can find but certainly a good value for your buck.'

b'I love this place, definitely he most authentic Chinese in Berlin. Have the feuertopf which is not on the menu (ask for it), it is great for a few friends and great value. The dumplings are some of the best I have tried. Menu might seem expensive bit courses are about sharing then having on your own.'
b'Really good Chinese hot pot!! Other things on the menu looked good too but were a bit pricy. Awesome place to eat at on a cold day and they have wifi!!'
b'Truly authentic Chinese food, with Hunan focus. Very reasonably priced and nice atmosphere.\n In summertime also relaxed seating outside.'

b"Well, I don't know what authentic Chinese food is, because I've never been to China, but this was really fantastic. We ordered two main courses, which turned out to be A LOT of food, and I think it's common for people to share a main course and get a starter. But I am so happy to have a really good restaurant in the neighborhood finally.\nI want to try most of the things on the menu, and some of them are a bit scary for Western palates (chicken feet and frog meat included) but in the end we just had a beef stew and a lamb thing that we finished.\nI look forward to eating there many more times in the future."

b'Actually address is Wichartstrasse 43. Fantastic family-run Chinese restaurant from south China. Excellent authentic food reasonably priced. One of my really regular places. I am eating thru the ENTIRE menu!!!'

b'Mit dem Lao Xiang hat sich endlich ein authentisches Chinarestaurant in den Pberg gewagt und ich hoffe es wird belohnt. Sehr leckeres Essen jenseits von Ente S\xc3\xbc\xc3\x9f-Sauer oder H\xc3\xbchnchen mit Reis. Wir hatten als Vorpeise die Jiaozi (mit Schwein gef\xc3\xbcllte Teigtaschen) und als Hauptgerichte das doppelt gebackene Schweinefleisch und den Tofu mit Schweine- und Rindfleisch. Alles war sehr lecker und in anst\xc3\xa4ndigen Portionen! Hungrig geht hier also niemand raus :-) Preis-Leistungs-Verh\xc3\xa4ltnis ist auch sehr in Ordnung inkl. netter Bedienung. Den einen Punkt Abzug gibt es nur f\xc3\xbcr das etwas kalte und minimalistische Ambiente im Restaurant. Alles in allem: absolute Empfehlung!!'

b"Searching for a new restaurant for tonight, we found this one and tried it the first time. Interior is modern and nice. The menu offers lots of authentic dishes and the photos shown are quite close to what you get. The choice of dishes is a bit wider than other chinese restaurants, most of them being hunan style. We tried a lot and it was very good compared to other chinese restaurants in Berlin. The spicy cucumber has a great unique taste, and all dishes came in their original hot and spicy taste. They even had very yummy durian fruit desserts. Service was very friendly and fast, just the boss hasn't been so friendly, but just showed up once. So with really nice food and service, also reasonable price, we enjoyed the evening a lot. This one is in the top league for Berlin. Now we tried it some more times and enjoyed the same nice experience. We will come back to try more Definitely worth a try for all who are missing chinese/sichuan/hunan food here and are too lazy to cook at home."

b'In a word - best dim sum I have ever had in my life, even better than in China!

Longer version (for the brave) - hands down, best dim sum I've had so far.

We've arrived here for dinner before it got really crowded, so if you plan on coming here after 20:00- reserve a table, the place is pretty small.

Once we've opened the menu we were thinking "ok, so what do we not order?!"
As my friend is vegetarian, we had about 9 options to choose from if you exclude the ones with chicken/pork/seafood.
Which is quite a lot! 

So we've settled on four, all vegetarian.
The one who took our order asked if we're vegan or vegetarian, we said no but didn't really understood why - until he put complimentary prawn crackers on the table, super nice and highly considerate! 

For a starter we had a soup that was kind of tasteless until we added some soy into it, but as the dim sum arrived we forget about it.

9 - kakao traum, absolute best! If we weren't full after all the food we'd totally order one more round of those, perfect flavor, perfect serving.

The others we've taken were also really good, but this was really something else.
From our point of view this is a place you can't really go wrong.
There's no good and bad, just tasty and tastier!'

b'Hmmm apart from the very cute utensils and the super cute dessert baozi (one with chocolate in panda shape and one with strawberry jam in piggy shape) the other dimsums are average at best.\n\nHa gaw and dumpling are most likely frozen ones from the supermarket with super thick wrappings. The filling is tasty but the wrap just kills the merit of the filling. XLB is very disappointing :('
b"My first experience with Dim Sum. I can't vouch for authenticity, but it was definitely delicious.\nGo early or reserve ahead. Space is limited"

b"Tried it out if curiosity. I got a salad (cucumber) and  dumplings. I loved both. They have so many kinds of dumplings. I tried a couple and have fallen in love with this place. Situated in a charming street , I think the only restaurant I'm this side of the Street, this place has a lot to offer. Definitely worth checking out."

b"Worst dim sum ever.. Yes.. I got suckered in as I saw the miss piggy dessert pictures on other reviews. The miss piggy dessert was nothing but bread with artificial strawberry jam in it. The rest of the dim sum was subpar compared to any other authentic Chinese venue. I ordered the typical dishes shi jin bao, cha shao bao, dumplings with vegetables, glass noodles, and carrots, and xiao long bao. It just didn't taste fresh at all. \nOur server was nice and attentive. She gets 2 star for that. End of story. I don't know how this place has so many stars."

b"Oh my goodness - AMAZING DUMPLING AND GREAT SERVICE!

Came her around 5 a couple days ago expecting to wait for a table (based on the other yelp reviews) but we were quickly seated and given cushions and a nice table spread to make sitting outside more comfortable. The waiter and waitress were very sweet and attentive and our food came out in a timely manner! The prawn crackers they serve before your meal are delightful. 

The dumplings were delicious and ask for the sweet chili sauce! It's really nice with the shrimp dumplings. The green tea is served in a nice porcelain detailed painted tea pot with adorable little cups. 

And every dumpling plate is \xe2\x82\xac4.90... What could be better!

Wasn't a huge fan of the dessert chocolate bear dumplings but it was good to try. Can't wait to go back!"

b"I wanted to try this place for some tjme and finally made it! Wonderful place for dumplings! Cheap, tasty, fast and a great service! It's a small cute shop in a nice area, the tea is super special. The menu is small but I find it a good thing. Their specialty is the dim sum. They have also quite a few options for vegetarians and vegans. Absolutely love it."
b'The 3 color(dish no. F4 Sanse) is the one I like the most! Good service, nice stuff but the food taste not surprising, not really recommend... I feel sorry'

b'so, SO good. amazing prices (we drank and ate until we were stuffed, for under 25 euros). small restaurant and cash only as far as i can tell, but i would come here every day if i could. most importantly, EXCEPTIONAL service (which is a rare find).'

b"I've always been a fan of dim sum. It's like heaven in your mouth. So when an opportunity presented itself to go to this place, I immediately took it. A companion was visiting town, so when we needed to have dinner, I suggested this place and made a reservation.

They don't have an extensive menu. They have two soup types, a handful of cold salads and other appetizers, about 5 vegetarian dim sum, and about 8 meat-filled dim sum. But that was enough to bring heaven to the inside of my mouth. 

My companion and I each ordered a soup, and I tried the wantan soup, which was delicate in its flavor and presentation. The wantans were floating in warm soupy bliss. It had just the right taste, and was meant more to enjoy and savor, than to simply slurp.

Then my companion and I ordered three different dim sum to share. With perhaps the most expensive order still being under 5 EUR, this wasn't an expensive meal. Each order have 5 pieces of dim sum, presented inside a steamer, and yes, they provide wooden non-disposable chopsticks. They also ask you what kind of sauce you want, as they have several choices at your disposal. 

Oh, the shao mai, and the shrimp-filled steamed mini buns, they were all heaven in my mouth. Next time, I'd go down the menu and try the other items.

I'll definitely be back. This is a great find, and is something that will be on the top of my list for a while. Reservations are recommended, as they are a very small place, with only a few tables inside."

b"Not the best dim sum I've ever had, but it was still really good. The price was fair and the waitress was really sweet and on the ball. The other woman working there was also really nice as well. Definitely coming back."

b"I love dim sum- it's my absolute favorite. This place was absolutely delicious, and they have some very unusual kinds. They have an entire selection of vegan/vegetarian dumplings, really adorable dessert buns, and unusual and flavorful sides.\n\nThe place is pretty small, but it has a nice homey atmosphere.  I'd recommend arriving before the peak dinner hours, or making a reservation. However, if they don't have any open tables, they also take your number and give you a call when one opens up, so you can explore the Prenzlauer Berg neighborhood in the meantime."
b'So so so good. Loved the wonton soup and the rice wrapper pork dumplings! The perfect place for a quiet, low-key, delicious meal.'

b"Edit May 2017: 2 years ago I visited the place and rated it with 5 stars.\nToday I'm giving it just one star because the dumplings taste like supermarket frozen ones.\nI expected fresh dumplings that are not teaming with preservatifs but there you go. Not gonna find that here."

b'This is a cozy cute place. Offers mostly a small portion with about 4 tiny one bite size (no bigger than McNugget size) dumplings costs 4.5-5 Euro average/per plate. I would not consider this to be exactly cheap. If you are hungry and sharing, you would probably want to order about 3-4 plates each person. I do not have a size of cow stomach and I am a tiny woman. Do the math. Should not be listed as \xe2\x82\xac. More like \xe2\x82\xac\xe2\x82\xac\xe2\x82\xac for what it is.'
b'Amazing place to experience authentic chinese dumplings while also being able to eat fully vegan if you want to! Everything vegan on the menu is deliciou and the staff is really nice!'

b"Excellent handmade dumplings and fast service. The dumplings didn't feel greasy to eat and everything feels authentic. The price is not cheap (we each paid 10 euros per head for lunch) and we're still hungry. You pay around 4-5 euros per dumpling order (usually 4 or 5 pieces). But very authentic experience."

b"We already ate at Lecker Song a lot of times since this little restaurant with just a few tables opened . 
It's always very good, always very fresh. Everything is homemade, original and tasty.
You're always warmly welcome, both the owner and the staff are very friendly.
A good place, to recommend."
b"Amazing dumplings and friendly service. This is the best dim sum I've had in Berlin. Their tea selection is also amazing."

b"Yum yum yum!! I came here on a Wednesday night based on the reviews and was not disappointed! I ordered four sets of dumplings, then liked them so much that I ordered more. I ended up trying all six different meat dumplings, and they were all fantastic. I would have to say that the shrimp and the chicken were my favorites, though I unfortunately can't report on their extensive vegan and vegetarian options as I was all about the meat this evening, but I hope to go back soon and try them. Staff was friendly and attentive without being pushy. Thanks for the great evening!!"

b"This little and tiny restaurant is hidden just behind Helmholtzplatz. The first time I tried to find it I almost passed it. Once you enter you are being welcomed by the friendly owner who offers you one of the very few buy cozy tables. They have various dumplings with many different fillings and tastes. I always just order a few and then more along the way. In that way you can spend a good and relaxed time with friends here. Food tastes solid but there is still a bit  room for improvement. It's pretty pricey as well but overall better than all the places along Kantstrasse. Certainly worth a try. But rather don't come in large groups."

b'This place is awesome.  We tried different types of dumplings, including sweet ones for dessert. We did not regret a single one.  I recommend making a reservation as the place has 5/6 small tables and fills up quickly. I also recommend eating something before as you will need a ton of dumplings to make a whole meal, and while the portion costs between 4/6\xe2\x82\xac, it adds up.  Kudos to the homemade shrimp chips you get as a free starter and very friendly staff. I will be coming back soon.'
b'All the homemade dumplings are so oriental and delicious, finally some different choices for chinese dishes other than rice and noodles:) i will definately visit again!'

b'one of the best dim sum place around the city, small and cozy restaurant with homemade dim sum menu and a dim sum vegetarian menu available too.

personally I loved the chicken and coriander one, so tasty!

will go back there for sure'
b'Probably the best dim sum in PBerg -- service is very attentive and kind.'

b"A fantastic place for vegetarians. A whole page full of veg dumplings and I also recommend the spicy cucumber salad. People says it's busy so consider going a Wednesday night. It's an easy tram ride from Mitte and a good excuse for checking out Prenzlauer."

b"This is place is truly amazing. The dim sum is incredible and the staff is very friendly. We had some seaweed salad that was quite delicious. Even the sweet dim sum for dessert were quite good. I plan on coming back very very soon. I highly recommend this place. I suggest making a reservation though, it fills up quickly and while the food comes quickly, people don't eat thaat quickly, so you might have to wait."

b"Here I go, adding my five stars to the constellation of raves. This place is a MUST whether you're veg or not. My boyfriend and I, vegetarians from DC, went there on our last night in Berlin and would have gone back every night if we'd had more time. Prenzlauer is a cool neighborhood, and this place is a gem. Decorated in a quirky, colorful style, it features astonishingly good dumplings and a cucumber salad you'll taste in your dreams. Everything is prepared with care and an eye toward color and texture, and the staff are friendly. The only possible improvement would be an array of specially prepared dipping sauces for the dumplings. The chili-infused oil simply isn't flavorful or distinctive enough for the venue. The sauce coating the cucumber salad, however, is a delight. This place is well worth going out of your way for."

b'If you are looking for a dumpling fix in Berlin, then look no further!! There\'s no need to go to Ming\'s or Kantstra\xc3\x9fe! Lecker Song was everything I had hoped for in decent authentic Chinese dumplings. A tiny place, tucked away on Schliemannstra\xc3\x9fe, I am glad I found this place and finally got to try it out. There\'s a large selection of meat and vegetarian dumplings. The meat ones consist mostly of classics such as Har Gau, Shu Mai, Xiao Long Bao and Wo Tie (pot stickers). The vegetarian ones, however, had more creative flavours. Being ravenous on a Friday night, we ordered a massive selection, including the vegetarian curried pumpkin dumplings. These were mouth wateringly more-ish and tasty, having a samosa-like flavour to them. A completely unexpected hit. Would definitely recommend trying that one out. The Har Gau were also one of our favourites that night. Now this dumpling is a Dim Sum classic. Simply put, it\'s a prawn and bamboo shoot dumpling with "crystal" translucent skin made of rice flour. I\'ve had many a Har Gau in my time and it is easy to get wrong. Often the skin is too heavy, cloying and just a nuisance to eat with chopsticks! For this dumpling, it is all about the texture of the filling.  The prawn filling should be "crunchy", with bite to it. Some restaurants will put too much cornflour and other ingredients in it to thin it out. For me, Lecker Song got it right on both counts. A must try when you order! Will definitely be returning and ordering everything on the menu! ;)'

b"Fantastic service! Nice small area with outdoor seating. Smoked tofu was possibly the best tofu I've ever had. The Shao Mai and Fen Guo were awesome as well!  For dessert, the Zongsi. I hope to return while I'm here."

b"Wonderful dim sum.  TONS of vegan and vegetarian options.  I highly recommend the tofu-shiitake dumplings: wonderfully seasoned, delicately sweet, with meaty tofu.  We also had the zucchini-rice noodle-morel dumplings and the tofu-morel-pea dumplings, which were also delightfully flavorful, hearty, and comforting.  The pickled cabbage appetizer was like slightly sweet kimchi and was delicious; the smoked tofu and bell pepper appetizer was also wonderful, with very high-quality bell peppers, extra-firm smoky tofu and lots of fresh herbs.  We also loved the red-bean bun dessert.    The place is tiny and feels like a mom-and-pop restaurant:  the atmosphere is cute but not fancy.  The waitstaff were helpful and attentive. Best Chinese food I've had in Berlin."

b'One of my favourite retaurants in Berlin. It's not shabby, not pricey and so authentic that the waiter is speaking Chinese with me. (Sadly I can't reply in Chinese) 

I often come here for the chicken feet. (Leave me alone I love them ok?) Beside that they have great lunch deals which go from 12:00 - 16:00 and cost about 6-7\xe2\x82\xac. I can highly recommend the fried rice or the noodlepots. Latter are HUGE and so so good. You get a tablet with a bowl of broth, a bowl with rice noodles and several small plates with toppings suchs as mushrooms, seaweed or walnuts. I usually have the vegetarian one with a lot of veggies but the ones with meat looked pretty good as well.
This place is compared to other chinese restaurants like "Good Friends" (which is close by) more quiet and elegant. The interior looks high class- almost posh and the restaurant owner is super nice. I think that's a place where you can drop by with your parents are some special date.

All in all a great place!'

b'So far I tried only "Crossing the bridge" soups, but they are outstanding. You get a huge bowl of broth, another bowl with crazy amounts of rice noodles and a set of ingredients you can add , they differ depending on the type of soup. It\'s definitely not the cheapest but worth the price. I would just prefer it to have a little less noodles and more extra ingredients like meat slices or nuts. But I am still very happy with this place. Exceptionally good for a hangover!'

b"It's a basic family restaurant style. We visit for first time and expected at least fresh vegetables and healthy food. Taste was just soso, however sprouts and peanuts turned already bad. We will not come back."

b"One of the best asian restaurants in Berlin (seriously) . The soups are between 6 to 10 Euro and are so huge (even by american standards) that it's usually a good idea to split the soup with someone else, which they will happily let you do. You might even consider ordering the aubergine and pork dish which is another standout. Also have more exotic stuff like pig feet which aren't bad."

b"This is the most authentic Chinese restaurant we've found in Germany. \xe7\x9c\x9f\xe7\x9a\x84\xe8\xb6\x85\xe7\xba\xa7\xe5\xa5\xbd\xe5\x90\x83\xef\xbc\x81\xe6\x88\x91\xe4\xbb\xac\xe5\xb7\xb2\xe7\xbb\x8f\xe7\xac\xac\xe4\xba\x8c\xe6\xac\xa1\xe6\x9d\xa5\xe5\x95\xa6\xef\xbc\x81309 sichuan style chilli chicken is just so good, crispy and tasty. And the place is very easy to find. With nice decorations and light."

b'Very nice place with great food. I said I wanna spicy so the waiter asked for extra spicy for me. Very thoughtful. If you are looking for a place that down to earth but has very good food. This is the best choice around the neighbourhood.'
b'Below average service quality, food is ok. The waiter was rude; we were always ignored thus decided not to tip generously, he gave us the eye and complained rudely.'

b"It indeed is a place that you can take a look if you really want some Chinese food in Berlin.

But the service here is extremely bad. A fat short-hair ~30-year-old male waiter here is a living definition of how bad the service can be provided. He ignored requests of customers and he was lazy and bad-tempered. He looks like a king in the restaurant but he is actually a pig: he only smiled at young ladies and frowns at male customers.

I wouldn't come back."
b'Very authentic Chinese Resturant. Try 309 (Sichuan-style Chilli Chicken).'

b"I've been to a number of Chinese restaurants in Berlin but this one is a real deal. I was so happy to find an authentic, yummy Sichuan Chinese place in this city. I read some people had problems with a rude male server there. My server was a female and she was friendly. Please don't get discouraged by a potential rude server. The food is worth a visit."
b"The best seafood soup I've ever had. Simple, yet so perfect. I don't remember the actual name but you can't miss it. The Shrimp is delicious! Really authentic. Definitely going back in a few days."

b'Honestly rating one star is overrating for tian-fu restaurant. Food, environment is "ok" in this place but overall not as good as the reviews. HOWEVER the service attitude towards to customers is ill-mannered especially the middle-aged waiter. The wait time was more than 30 minutes and this rude waiter said its normal to wait such a long time for dinning like its the customers problem.\nI also noticed that other customers came in without reservation were treated inpatient.\nI would not consider to have Asian food in this place any more.'
b"Who knew I would find one of my favorite Chinese restaurants ever in Berlin. And I don't even like Chinese food. Have spent a lot of time in China as well. Thanks guys."

b"I went here with some friends who highly recommended this restaurant. It is pretty authentic in Chinese cuisine but I didn't particularly love it. We ordered a bunch of dumplings and dim sum items. They were all pretty good, just not amazing in my opinion. I would try it again but definitely try some others out first before I go back."
b'great chinese restaurant! With quite a nice selection of meals, not only the classic ones!'

b'Word of the day is BANGING BUFFET. This place got a pretty good buffet if you ask me, take my word or dont you foolios. The staff and waiters are deaf and blind so dont expect anything from them. Its all about the food. Xie xie means thanks you in chinese so dont forget to use that one, it all ways works. Trust me. Peace'

b'As far as I know this is the only good Chinese restaurant in Berlin, and it\'s actually as good as anything I"ve had back in San Francisco, New York, or Houston.\n\nOnce Berlin gets a decent cal-mex or tex-mex restaurant I\'ll never have to leave the city again for good food.'

b"Our favorite Chinese restaurant in Berlin..  Try the spicy chicken (#309).  It's borderline too hot for me but the taste on the chicken and veggies is amazing.  We eat from here a couple times per month.  May need reservations for evenings."
b"By far the best restaurant for Sichuan food in Berlin! Couldn't find anything like this outside of China ;-)\nTop!"
b'Excellent chinese food! I can absolutely recommend this restaurant! Service is not too friendly but still polite. Unfortunately this restaurant does not accept credit cards.'

b"It gets five stars for being the most authentic northern Chinese cuisine I've had in Berlin (I used to live in Beijing); malheureusement the prices reflect that.\n\nDo you want \xe5\xb9\xb2\xe7\x85\xb8\xe5\x9b\x9b\xe5\xad\xa3\xe8\xb1\x86, \xe5\xae\xab\xe4\xbf\x9d\xe9\xb8\xa1\xe4\xb8\x81,  \xe5\x9c\x9f\xe8\xb1\x86\xe4\xb8\x9d\xef\xbc\x8c\xe7\xba\xa2\xe7\x83\xa7\xe8\x8c\x84\xe5\xad\x90, \xe7\x81\xab\xe9\x94\x85.... \xe7\xad\x89? It's all here and it's all very, very tasty, \xe9\x9d\x9e\xe5\xb8\xb8\xe5\xa5\xbd\xe5\x90\x83, you won't regret it."

b'I quite enjoyed this restaurant.  Unlike a few others in the street (on a Saturday afternoon), this one actually had clientele. 

I indulged in a number of vegetarian options - dim sum, aubergine, mixed veg, and a water spinach dish.  All good - the aubergine being the highlight.  

Friendly service, quiet, and good food.'

b'If you order a main course marked with 3 chilis in Tian-Fu, it really is uncompromisingly hot. Authentic Schezuan food, I must say.


 However, consistency seems to be an issue. Also the service of the male waiter was lacking.'

b"So far, I found this place to be an adequate Sichuan restaurant. Atmosphere is nice, service is friendly and good, and the food is not too bad, although I haven't tried too many dishes. The good news is that the dimsum is actually homemade, the bad news is that it isn't that great but full marks for trying. The roast duck was passable, the fried rice was quite good and a couple of other dishes were tolerable.


 I will be back again as the hotpot looks quite interesting and so do some of the more traditional Sichuan dishes. The only comparable Sichuan restaurant in Berlin is the original Ming Dynasty in Br\xc3\xbcckenstra\xc3\x9fe 6 and they are both pretty much neck-and-neck, though Ming is perhaps a little cheaper.


 Oh, the other good news is that I did not detect much use of monosodium glutamate in Tian Fu, so that is definitely a plus point.


 NOTE: I did come by again for the Sichuan hotpot and it was pretty good. Still, I think the Lucky Star in Friedrichstrasse does a slightly better hotpot with a tastier soup. Just my opinion!"

b'After hearing positive reviews and being big fans of Szechuan food we decided to try having dinner at Tian Fu. The restaurant was packed with a good mix of locals and Chinese which looked promising. The dimsums arrived quickly after ordering and they looked and tasted great. However, if the restaurant claims to be representative of Szechuan cuisine, the main course(s) would ensure that it\'s an experience best avoided. The Szechuan beef and chicken was so over-salted that one could easily think that salted meats are preferred in China. Either that or the cook had a new girlfriend. Tian Fu uses salted econo-"meat" imported from Brazil (avoiding EU tariffs on fresh produce). The waitress was very nice and understanding but that did not fully compensate for the totally inedible first round. The re-hashed dishes (after some polite complaints) were merely inedible. We both know what Szechuan cooking should taste like, ie nothing like what the Tian Fu attempts to serve.\nWe will not repeat this experience and cannot recommend dining here.'

b"finally, my quest to find an adequate substitute for my favorite sichuan haunt in PA may have come to a successful end!


 perhaps my previous virginity regarding sichuan food has kept me from discovering the chili-haven that is tian fu on uhlandstrasse  after all, it's been around for over a decade, and it took me this long to find it.


 i've gone three times now (more than any other resto this summer), and i'll most definitely be back 


 http://bitchinberlin.wordpress.com/2009/07/22/tian-fu-wdorf/"
b'wer typische szecuan-gerichte probieren m\xc3\xb6chte, ist dieses restaurant genau richtig. feuertopf ist zum empfehlen!'
b'Very good food here, freshly made. Restaurant and the staff are attentive and good...'
b"Best Chinese I know. Always delicious and friendly. Very reasonably priced as well.\nLunch menue is unbeatable in quality and price! Tastebuds what'ya say ?\nYUMMIE"

b"This is a great Chinese restaurant. Food is great, spicy but acceptable because of the quality and the freshness of the food.
