Lots of Chinese restaurant is using glutamates to cover and give the impression of Chinese food. Here none, it's just well prepared with delicious and fresh vegetables. We loved it really!"

b'Really good Chinese food! Had spicy chicken with pineapple, carrots and peppers. It was really solid. Nice interior, very clean and modern, white tablecloth kinda place. Very nice service and a menu in English. Much appreciated!'

b'Been here twice. Great Chinese food! The chicken was tender and fresh and the veggies were perfect. Friendly, fast service as well. Nice quiet neighborhood to walk around in as well. Will definitely come back for the dim sum which looked delicious.'
b"Not bad, it's exactly Chinese style. The boss is from Zhejiang, the soup is good, home style."

b'Great authentic Chinese food at reasonable price. The location is great although it might have been a little cosier if the lighting would have been a little bit darker.\nI tried a very spicy chicken, believing it would be Sichuan spicy. This was not the case. The chicken was great but not as spicy as expected.\nI would easily recommend this place!'
b'At the moment this is one of my favourite chinese restaurant in Berlin. The food is delicious!'

b"Best Yumcha ever!! Get the baked Spring rolls. Quick friendly service. Excellent English but you must book! Saw so many people get turned away because every table was booked and it's only a small restaurant."

b'Come early to grab a seat.  This small little place has a great little cozy atmosphere, but even more important are the amazing dumplings.  We enjoyed the pork steamed dumplings and in fact placed a second order because they were too delicious to share.  The rest of the food we ordered like the peking pork was good, but nothing to write home about so that is why I only gave 4 stars.  Also the service was not the best.  They were friendly but rushed and had to flag them down several times to place an order for food and drinks.'

b'I walked past this place a few times already and I always thought it looked neat. Now that I have been inside I know that the appearance did not fool me. :-P\nThe service was really friendly and every single dish we tried was amazing! Obviously you have to try any variety of their dumplings when you are here! :-)'

b'Overhyped and overpriced. The dumplings were okay, but nothing to write home about. The salmon was a disaster- overcooked, huge chunks of rock salt, underwhelming sauce and really for 8.50\xe2\x82\xac it should have been at least twice the size. The best part of my 20\xe2\x82\xac lunch was the house made lemonade, which was actually more of a light limeade spritz.'

b'Quite yummy dumplings and cucumber slices salad! Came here for lunch with my meat-eating friends, not knowing if there would be anything for me. Luckily, I was happily surprised with delicious veggie dumplings. Sat outside with my puppy and enjoyed the view!'

b"The dumplings were really amazing. My friends and I were feeling adventurous so we ordered many different kinds of dumplings. My personal favorite was the pink lamb. But I also loved the black beef and the orange prawn. They were super flavorful. The dumplings are big and very filled. Fat fat dumplings!! Just what I like. But the baked ones (which are fried) are kinda small.

I say skip the Shanghai dumplings -- no soup in a xiao long bao?! You may fool these Berliners but you can't fool me! I was Chinese in my past life. 

It's affordable but I kind of wish the dumplings were slightly cheaper so I could eat more of them!! For 10 euros you can eat 6 dumplings if you share with friends. I would certainly go back!!"

b'Fantastic dumplings and fresh juices.

This restaurant is famous for they yummy dumplings. The rumour was correct: 5 star! 

We tired the vegetarian, orange shrimp and beef (rind). So much flavour, perfectly cooked. 
With this we drank four juices as they were hard not finish right away; DELICIOUS! 
(Only fruit!)
Watermelon+lychee
Cucumber, ginger, mint
Lychee, lime, soda 
Carrot, honey melon, honey

On top of this super cute and friendly staff, good outdoor tables and a very cool toilet!'

b"It' a small restaurant located at the conner on a street. The service was very nice and friendly. They greet us really well. Mother of dumpling was tasty, I really like it. Duck dumpling needs to change to beans dumpling because all I tasted was bean, just a little bit of duck meat inside. Beef Roll were to sour. 3 start for nice services and some good dumpling but others was not worth for its price."

b"I came here on a recommendation from a co-worker and was not disappointed.  The place is small but exudes a coolness factor. Located a short walk from Rosenthaler Platz underground on a quiet street it's easy to miss if you don't walk far enough down the street. Just walk past the Salumi place and you'll see it

I asked the waitress what amount of dumplings she recommended for 1 person. The waitress suggested I order 2 sets of dumplings so I tried the Prawn dumplings and the soup dumplings plus an order of edamame. 

The dumplings come in servings of 4 and are accompanied by 3 dipping sauces: a soy sauce-base one, a sweet one and a slightly spicier one. 

The Prawn dumplings were very good and the shrimp was not overcooked or mushy. The soup dumplings were very good too, however, they were not very soupy.  I would have preferred them with more broth inside the way they make them in New York's Chinatown. But the minced pork filling was flavorful. Two orders was definitely enough as I was stuffed so I am glad I didn't order more. They have a great selection of teas and juices here too. 

The service was quick and the waitress was friendly. Turns out she was from California so that explains the better than average service. I can't believe it took me this long to find this place. It ranks in my Top 10 and I will be coming back on my next work trip."
b'So good. Nothing else to add other than I wish I lived in Berlin so I could eat here everyday.'

b"Those dumplings will make you think you just went to Chinese heaven.

Start with the black beef soup - it's black dumplings dipped in a sweet/spicy aromatic soup, which tastes even better once it mixes with the fillings. 

Shanghai dumplings are a classic, try all three different sauces that come with them.

For dessert, nougat dumplings work quite well - they come with delicious vanilla sauce!

For a claustrophobic Hong Kong experience try visiting the restroom."
b'The food is okay, but feels a bit uninspired; you could say it looks better than it tastes. A restaurant whose main selling point is the ambience rather than the menu.'
b"Good food, but great dumplings.  Friendly staff and a clean restaurant.  You'll leave with a happy belly. :)"

b'Maybe I'm spoilt by all the great Asian food we have in New Zealand, but the food we had was pretty ordinary. I think "Asian fusion" can sometimes be used to describe something that isn't authentic, or good.

Prawn dumplings were ok, lamb dumplings were just a meatball wrapped in a thick pastry. 

It was ok, but not somewhere I would be raving to my friends about.'

b'The place is very small so if you are more than two, you better get a reservation. 

Food is very good. Pretty fast and a lot of dishes. I would recommend to choose different combiantion and share them. Not all the Dumplings are the same size, even they are four per order. 

The menu comes in English for all of us who are not very fluent in German. 

Prices are not high and the service is very friendly specially for the host.'

b"The best Chinese dumplings I've had in Berlin, this far. Shanghai soup dumplings were good, but should have also been served with a spoon, to prevent broth from leaking out before eating. The beef dumplings were the best - very flavorful & aesthetic with black sepia-died colored dumpling -skin.  The decor is very innovative - my faves bring the purple tinged lighted  window into the kitchen, the wrapper-style ceiling lamps, and the hidden restroom, that is completely bright yellow. 2 thumbs up!"

b'I don\'t know what has changed, but the dumplings we had last night tasted awful. If I were to guess, they used leftovers from yesterday (or even days ago). The "steamed" shrimp dumplings looked just like the "pan fried" version - both were very greasy and the dumpling wrap/dough was very chewy. It also had a very foul stench.\n\nMonths has gone by since we ate here and we liked the place, but we\'re no longer going to eat here. Seriously, there are a lot of other places popping up that\'s offering fresh, tasty, dim-sum.'

b"Simply put, these are some of the best dumplings I have ever had, and I have had my share of Chinese dim sum, dumpling places from all over (aside from going to China itself).

This is not your ordinary fast food simple dumplings, this is not pot stickers people.  This is the real mo-fo deal.

The dumplings are first off, homemade, second, they are also large and big sized.

Vegetarian is filled with flavored noodles and chewy veggies that have great flavor.  You will find also unique ones, instead of standard pork shu mai (which they have and are also big and delicious), such as a duck filled fig, Shanghai with broth inside, and a peculiar and delicious salmon wrap that is delicate, with delicious tasting fish nestled in a rice wrap with delicate seasoning.

Noodle salad (Fu Ling) is aromatic, delicate, bursting with fresh lime flavors melding with the small chicken pieces served on a nice simple piece of red cabbage leaf.

Get the mint and/or honey ginger teas.  They hit on a damp cold evening wonderfully.

Service here is also fantastic, in a city that has often curt/rude and just flat out bad service often this place stands out like a ray of light.

Go earlier or at least make a reservation because it's very popular as I discovered, even for showing up on a lazy weekday evening.  

Fantastic."

b"The dumplings are pretty good, but the servings are small. They always have a set menu for lunch special, and that was pretty good. They're not traditional Chinese dim sum, but I was intrigued and enjoyed the flavours for what it was. You probably will not fill yourself up here unless you're with friends, but the food is pretty good. It's hip and trendy, and there are tons of booths. I ate here alone, but they were still really accommodating to my needs.\n\nI ordered a dumpling set with the soup dumplings, which were delicious and one of my first forays into the soup dumpling world. I also ordered the winter dumplings which were rich and a bit sweet. To top off my dumpling set, it also came with a soup, which was pretty good. The menu is simple, mostly based around the dumplings/dim sum. For a fast, quick lunch with good value, I'd go to Yumcha Heroes for the set menu. It's a relatively light meal (I think only three or four come in a set,) but it's affordable and has space for a lot of people, especially if youw ant to share. I didn't order any alcohol with my meal, but I did order one of those blooming teas which looked beautiful in a high glass."
b'Waited 30min for dumplings! Dumpling itself was OK, however no spoon delivered for the soup\nUnfortunately also no dogs allowed in the place, also not very charming staff'

b"Yumcha Heroes! 

I mean, the name is just catchy, right? It is. Couple that with the kitschy little sign of two dumpling heroes high-fiving...and well, can you go wrong? You cannot. 

On a beautiful, gloriously sunny evening in Berlin I found myself perched just inside the patio at Yumcha awaiting my first Asian cuisine in Berlin aside from the sushi/Viet outpost in my supermarket.

I was pumped. DUMPLINGS. Let's do this. 

The restaurant was comfortably full...the patio pleasantly plump with patrons. Tables turn relatively fast because the food is pushed out with a nice clip. Good for me, as I was famished after a day of soaking in sunshine (finally!). 

An Aperol Spritz (or two) found me as well as the Shu Mai dumplings (pork, serving size =4 for about 3 euro). I also ordered the Jacob's Chicken, which was good but in hindsight I would've rather had a plate of steamed veggies and MORE dumplings. The dumplings are where its at, I do highly recommend. The silk cube tofu was also a hit, but I think next time soup, dumplings, more dumplings, veggies. That shall be my winning combo. 

Service was good despite being full, and pretty friendly. I noticed they do take credit cards (not sure if its just German bank cards though), but I'd bring cash just in case. 

Three drinks (eeps, school night!) plus dumplings and a main entree set me back approximately 35 euro. Not the cheapest (though the dumplings are), what really hit the bill was the 16 euro chicken...which wasn't even close to my favorite thing. 

So, lesson: go get the dumplings. 

YUMCHA HEROES! High five! 

*ps pro-tip, skip their desserts and head across the street for ice cream."

b'While in Berlin I had yelp a place for great dim-sum and came across this place. With the great number of review and four stars I was for sure I would find great food here. To my surprise I was very disappointed. I am a dim-sum lover and this place did not meet my standard at all. The skin on the dumplings was way too thick and the meat was not the best quality. I am giving this place a three stars mainly for the presentation of the food and how cute the restaurant is but the food I would say about 2 stars max.'

b'If I could give less that 1 star, I would. My wife and I used to love this place, especially the dumplings. We decided to go there yesterday, october 16, around 14:00. The waiter who was serving us was one of the rudest people I have met in Berlin, which says a lot considering the city is known for bad service. So we ordered our food and tap water because personally, I think paying 4 euros for a bottle of water is purely insane. The guy was immediately irate that we had ordered tap water even though we ordered 4 other dishes to go with the tap water, whatever water under the bridge. We get our ribs that must have fallen into a bag of salt and we are both thirsty as a fish out of water.  THE GUY REFUSED TO GIVE US MORE WATER!!! The food is not good anymore and the staff or just this one guy is a deplorable version of a human. I will never go back and I really hope this place the best :p'

b"The ambience was fabulous - it was like stepping into Barbie's playhouse, but instead of Barbies, there were Chinese chefs cooking up a storm making XLB.

I love the decor, the friendly service, but this is not your typical Shanghai dumpling joint. It must be a foreign concept around here, but these dumplings had barely any soup, a thick wrapper, and the meat was somewhat hard and compacted (not melt in your mouth like it should be).

I would however, recommend the watermelon lychee drink which was refreshing and something I have never tasted before.

Love this place for drinks with friends, but I can't help but think it's a bit overhyped and overpriced."

b'It's cool, the decor is modern, the service is efficient and friendly. I like being in the space. 

I'm not a stickler for authenticity, as long as the food tastes good, I'm ok with whatever fusion liberties a restaurant wants to take. I was expecting that Yumcha would mix a little of traditional Chinese "small eats" with some western ingredients. And they did that very nicely with the cold jellyfish salad. It's got the crunch and freshness I'd associate with the classic Chinese dish, but more strongly seasoned with sesame and chili. I'd recommend that if you're not squeamish about jellyfish. 

However, I did not like their dumplings. I was pretty disappointed with all the hot dishes I ordered which included the Shanghai dumpling, nuo mi ji (chicken and rice in lotus leaf), pan fried shrimp dumpling, and shu mai. All are classic dimsum dishes and unfortunately none of their strong points were played up. 

The shrimp dumplings were understuffed and although it said pan fried, the dumpling when it got to the table did not have that crispiness to the wrapper. It makes no sense to serve pan fried dumplings in the same plate as bokchoi with sauce. The sauce seeps under the dumplings and makes the the crispy bottom all soggy! *cry* 

The shanghai dumplings were a very poor imitation of what they could have been (inspired by the Shanghainese xiao long bao). Again, wrappers are too thick. And they really should have spoons available for the shanghai dumplings because the whole idea is to catch all the tasty soup that's inside them. 

The shumai was so-so. Maybe just the red lighting inside making the pork look particularly dark and unappetizing. Nuo mi ji was ok, and probably the one dish we had that felt like it was true to the classic dish. 

Anyway, all that to say, I do not recommend this to anyone seeking dumpling enlightenment.'

b'My favourite dumplings in Berlin. Superbe presentation of this little treasures, a little bit fusion (sorry for using this term), colorful and bold, mouthwatering flavours. Try the duck ones! The ambience is rather casual and an makes it a perfect place for lunch.'

b"I really like Yumcha Heroes. They have great dumplings and the honey spareribs are to die for. Also, their homemade drinks are really good.\nI've been there a couple of times, and every time the waitresses seems a bit distreet and maybe even a bit young - and not as professional as one could want. This is however fine with me, but the reason for 4 stars."

b"Came in and the place was real busy but we were seated immediately. Staff was real friendly and spoke English. Menus also had English which was nice. \n\nOrdered the black beef, lamb, and pork dumplings, all were very tasty. But my favorites were the Shanghai pork dumplings. Lots of flavor! Definitely recommended if you're in the area!"

b"For the price and the image they sell I'd say MEH! Not bad but far from being awesome. Vegetarians have only one option. I ordered 8 dumplings,  4 steamed and 4 fried (waitress was kind of shocked I ordered steamed and fried. It was my 1st time I wanted to try both and have some variety since Im vegetarian)\n\nHalf of my dumplings arrived with big holes. It was a a mess to eat. Flavor was ok. More like a mince of everything. Just ok dumplings. Sauces were very over powering (they offee three which they should get credit for. But better focus on one brilliant one)."

b"Perfect little Joint. The service is good and the dumplings are amazing. The beat I've ever had!\nOur table was right next to the electric door and it got really cold so that was a downer. \nBooking a table is highly recommended!"

b'Found myself the only Asian face in the place outside of the wait staff.  Only thing authentic was the brisk unfriendly service.  Not worth it for the price.  Also had major stomach issues from the meal afterwards.  Found myself bemoaning a few culturally insulting things starting with the industrial sweet and sour sauces they served with the dumplings, and the photo of a real Cantonese Place on the wall which I sourly missed after this meal.  If this is the level that Chinese good has come in Berlin, then it\'s a nasty blow for my culture.  Conclusion, Yumcha heroes is an "ethnic food experience" for non ethnic hipsters that are interested more in food photography then food.  Pretty colors, definitely more important then flavor here.  Chinese people avoid and save yourself 20 euros.'

b"Yumcha's dumplings were quite tasty. We really enjoyed it overall. I've had better dumplings at some places in San Francisco and I'm not qualified to say what's truly authentic or whatever, but either way, I expect to eat here a few more times while we're in Berlin. I particularly liked the Shanghai (soup) dumplings and the White Chicken dumplings. Reservations recommended."
b'Extremely tasty, yet maybe a bit too pricey. Think 20\xe2\x82\xac per pers. incl. a drink to be fully satisfied... Will come back when I get a pay raise!'

b"Excellent!  the winter dumplings with duck, chestnut and fig doesn't work, but that was the only disappointment.  The vegetarian soup was better than the beef soup, less greasy.  Silken tofu divine, steamed and very thinly sliced.  Orange prawns (dumpling skin tinted slightly orange) delicious and nice that it comes with some bok choy.  Shanghai dumplings good but should be served with a spoon to better capture juice.  English speaker friendly.

Each bamboo steamer is labeled so vegetarians need not fear any of their dishes touch meat!!!

Open kitchen so you can watch with awe and a smile.  A few of the dumplings, such as the beef, some in a dumpling that is dark purplish in color -- not exactly an appetizing color."

b'I'm always a sucker for dumplings.  So how could I resist the places that is supposed to have the best dumplings in Berlin?   

While I was tempted to order every dumpling they had I was talked into something a bit more moderate for this days lunch.  We got the steamed tofu, shanghi dumplings, and the lotus wrapped rice.  All of which are good touch stones for these sorts of things, if you can't do these well there is no point in the other things.  

The tofu was very good.  Silken, soft, and a lovely chili sauce with just the right touch of heat.  Loved it.  Great start.  The Shanghai dumplings were good, but typically when someone says shanghai dumplings I'm thinking soup dumplings.  These were not.  But very tastey, juice and the wrapper was very well done. Gave just the right texture.  Plus these were good sized so another nice touch.  The lotus wrapped rice was the disappointment.  A bit dried out and probably a bit on the old side.  When I learned to make these from a woman in Hong Kong she kept saying they have to have enough "juice" in them to be good.  Plus they can't be old.   And these just didn't work for me based on her criteria.  Also the dipping sauces were a disappointment.  Things pretty much out of a jar.  

Good but not a home run, but I would go back and try some of the other dumplings and I would always get that lovely tofu!'

b'The first dumplings I have ever had the pleasure of eating. A very enjoyable evening with 2 friends, sharing 5 delicious dishes in a beautiful restaurant and chilled (steamed) atmosphere. Friendly and efficient staff. Love the pink kitchen light.'

b'We read a lot about this restaurant - tipped as the best dumpling place in berlin.
Needless to say it stood testament to its fandom. 

Ambience: The restaurant has an open kitchen which also implies cooking fumes passing over you as you are immersed in conversation. I in particular do not like to leave a restaurant smelling of the food I ate, so naturally chose to sit outside. The feel outside was pleasant. It offers a nice relaxing time watching the busy bustling street of people and trams pass by as you await your dumplings.

Food: The quality of the food was perfectly in sync with the reviews of the place. The White Chicken in particular was fresh and juicy. The SHANGAI was also nice with pork cooked to tenderness. With a variety of dumplings combined with a choicest  combination of the 3 sauces literally leaves you with a mouthful of China. 

Price: With Quality comes price. If you are the type of person who is satisfied with 20 dumplings stacked neatly as a mountain on your plate, then this is not the place for you. (Wok Show, Berlin). Here you get a general helping of 4 dumplings for an average 5.5 Euro. So it is in the higher price range. 

They also do accept Cards.'

b'The only reason I did not give it five stars is that it is so expensive! In my experience, a big part of the appeal of dumplings is that they are affordable - at 1.50 Euro per dumpling, these are pricier than even those in London or New York! That said, I still went there and very much enjoyed my meal. The classic Shanghai soup dumplings are great, and unlike some other places, they did not stick to the bottom so all the soup leaked out:)'

b'My all times favorite are the sweet and juicy spare rips, the fresh and crunchy bak choi, the Shanghai dumplings with hot broth inside and the fresh juices. The atmosphere is hip, buzzing and friendly the price range okay for mitte.'

b"Dumplimgs which were said to be the highlight were served nicely and were ok but nothing too amazing.\nService was the worst we have had during our 4 months stay in Berlin for no reason..:/ \nAll together it is not cosy or special and I went there because recommendations were good-but it's really no big deal and there is no reason to visit. Transit just around the corner is awesome and so is Rice Queen on Danziger strasse. .. Just easily skip this place..good luck:)"

b"I once chocked on the bulb on a bok choy at Yumcha Heroes, and while it was not their fault, I didn't feel like going there for a long time. But in the end, the dumplings lured me back in. 

I usually opt for the fried dumplings (either veggie or prawn) that come with a serving of bok choy on the side, and usually the bok choy is as fresh as spring rain, but last time they were dry as a desert. But I think it was a one off thing, hopefully, probably.

The dumplings are massive in size, and the metal chop sticks can make it somewhat of a slippery experience, but so it goes for everyone around the table - jokes are made, and then you just keep on eating, forgetting that you look like a fool.

It's the dumplings you go for, but they also serve up some summer like rolls, as well as bigger plates of heartier dishes, just in case you want to mix it up a little. I have fallen for the octopus salad, it has a little citrus twang to it - and a perfect summer dish when you want something lighter.

If you want to sit on the terrace you better make a reservation, but it's not so bad sitting inside either, as you can catch all the action in the kitchen, and the open flames that sometimes hits the ceiling."
b'Friendly, German speaking (!) service, Best Dim Sum between here and New York, in the evenings between 7-9.30 pm you need to book. Verdict: Excellent !'

b"Brilliant. The authenticity is debatable, the dim sum is fancied up a bit. That being said, it hardly matters. The char siu bao was damn close and super delicious. The siu mai was fantastic. We enjoyed the spare ribs, winter dumplings, shrimp roll and a few other delectable dumplings. All in all this was a perfect experience save for the long wait. I'm not sure if this was abnormal, and even though I feel  25 minutes for dim sum is a bit much, the experience was hardly ruined because of it. 

At least we got to spend some time catching up with friends. 

Highly recommend this place, and I think it's up in my top 10 or so of Berlin."

b'Wanting something different in the nahe, Yelp directed us here. Thanks Yelp! 

Despite the many restaurants in the area, we have often written it off as too touristy. This place confirms how silly that idea is. We walked into the tiny dining space and grabbed the last seat near the door. Despite the cool air from outside, we were cozy with the steam coming out of the open kitchen. 

Service was speedy, as was the food. 4.50 -5.50 for sets of 4 dumplings allowed us to try several different options. Everything was crazy good with the beef soup actually being our favorite. You have the option for some of the dumplings to be either fried or served in a bamboo box and I actually preferred the steamed. We got the honey ribs,  shanghai dumplings, prawn dumplings, & beef soup and we were satisfied!

Yumcha served just what we wanted. Affordable, fresh, and perfectly different.'

b"When I came across this place I was super excited, as I love dumpling, wanted soup, and they have dumpling soup. The interior is pretty cool with a sort-of-tinted window, so you can look into the kitchen. Generally this place is \xc3\xbcber cool with a sleek interior, and, come on, the name is just fantastic! \n\nThe staff is also super nice, and the place generally seems to be family run, which is something I really like. So why only 3 stars? Well, I settled on 3, as the food was good, but not mind.blowing and I had issues with the dumping. The flavors they have a nice, but the veggie one is not that great and for all of them, in my opinion, the dough this waaaay too thick. I felt like I was only eating dough half the time. If you want soup though definitely check them out, and if you don't mind doughy dumplings, then definitely give this place a try."
b'Good to know to have a reasonable Dumplings Restaurant in Berlin.'

b"This place has a really nice atmosphere, friendly stuff, both outside & inside sitting area equally great, and of course delicious dumplings! It doesn't take too long to get the food even though the place is almost always packed. It's great for any occasion, family or date. My favorite are the prawn dumplings - they are exquisite, but as I am not a huge meat eater I was not the biggest fan of the beef ones.  A nice detail is the wine menu - when choosing a glass,  you pick either Good, Better or Best. Can reveal that the good one is pretty sweet! Overall - awesome!"

b"This is the kind of place I wish I could eat at once a week for a long time in order to learn the subtleties of every item. It's hard to know how to order, since the dumplings aren't necessarily a standard size, so you kind of have to dive in and take some risks. 

Some are heavier or bigger than others, and there is quite a variety of fillings and other items, so be brave and make it an adventure.  I had the duck dumplings and a tall glass of hot tea. Next time I would get the Shanghai with the broth inside. 

The billowing steam from the kitchen makes for a very Blade Runneresque experience, especially if it's a rainy night. Service was great."

b"I'm compelled to go back every few weeks - that's how addictive their dumplings are.  The inside gets a little cramped so I wouldn't come here with a large group of people.  Decent wine.  Have never ordered something I didn't like."

b'The Xiaolongbao is really good.  We ended up getting two orders with bac choi.  The food & staff are great.  They have a very interesting restroom (WC).  It is in a hidden wall & the stalls are in a hidden wall as well.  Very cool place to eat in Berlin.'

b"I had a great dinner at this place tonight. I saw a reference to it on a NYTimes food blog and so thought I'd give it a whirl. The dim-sum was really very good. We had the orange shrimp and green vegetable dumplings (one order of each). Together with an order of edamame, it was plenty for the two of us. 

The decor is, as others note, cool. It's not super-flashy-ultra-modern-Asian kind of sleek, but it is sleek-ish and comfortable. 

The service is, well, spotty. But, they were busy, and I gather this place does not thrive on a reputation for top-notch service. Instead, it's got really good dim-dum, and really good prices (for everything, with a bunch of beers, water, dumplings, edamame, it was 28 euros)."

b'I came here again after a couple of years and found the prices to have gone up, while the quality has decreased a bit. Still, some dumplings deserve special mention. The orange dumplings are by far my favorites: the shrimps were very fresh and the flavors blend perfectly. The juices are also nice (cucumber-apple-ginger). You need to flag down the waiters to get served and the niceties begin only at the end when they remind you tip is not included in the bill. Overall, good but pricey for Berlin standards.'
b'Super delish. The honey ribs and bok choy are delicious and perfectly seasoned. The bill can add up quickly, but definitely a must try! Great in- and outdoor spaces.'
b'Best dim sum you can get in town. Nothing compared to the real Chinese dim sums. But still good. Rather on the expensive side. Service is slow and kinda unfriendly. Atmosphere is great though.'

b'I spotted this place when wandering near a Berlin park. The handmade dumplings were tempting even though I ate shortly before. I ordered the chicken, thai basil, chili, and ginger dumplings along with the Cho You Bao (yeast bun with sweet pork, oyster sauce and ginger. \n\nI looked forward to the dumpling flavor combination, but the flavors combined together and nothing stood out. They came with three sauces- soy (too salty), chili sauce, and another (too sweet). And the Cho You Bao was not as fluffy as I imagined. There was much dough, but the meat was tasty with warm Christmassy tasting spices.'

b"Cool name, I wish I'd come up with it! The food, however, remains something to be desired. They do predominantly Asian-fusion dumplings, so don't be fooled by the name that they do full on authentic dim sum. I have yet to find a place in Berlin that does to be honest. I found the pricing a bit steep for what they are, so opted for a set menu at lunch time, which was ok. The dumplings, coloured according to the filling, have a thick cloying dough.  Black for beef, bright pink for lamb, white for chicken and green for veggie. In my opinion, they did not look at all appetising. I get why they have coloured them so, for easy identification when they're all being boiled/steamed in one pot. It just gave a kinda mass produced vibe to it. No refinement. And if you're a true dim sum fan, you'd know what I mean. The only redeeming thing was the xiao long bao, for the uninitiated, these are pork dumplings with broth in them, usually served with a vinaigrette dip. These were fantastic and authentic. If you're looking for a fun lunch option in Mitte then worth a try but there are so many other options I'd rather go for."
b'AWESOME! Nice atmosphere, great food. Try the roastbeef strips.'

b'Very tasty dim sum-style dumplings and rolls at reasonable prices.  Actually, a little expensive, but the portion sizes are larger than I expected, so it evens out.  I would have preferred smaller portions so that I could order more dishes.  In the end, 4 plates (two kinds of dumplings, two kinds of rolls) and a salad were enough for two people.  Seating is mostly on benches and the restaurant is fairly small.  Service was good.  The beer selection is a bit of the worst of East Asia varieties in bottles.  I will definitely go back, but probably for lunch or snacks.  Not sure I would make an evening out of it.'

b'The best Chinese food in Berlin.  If anyone knows of a better place let me know.

The honey glazed ribs are wonderful and the bok choy is also.  I dig the sauce on the bok choy.  The salmon salad is also tasty with a little spice, though it could be more.  The lamb dumplings are my favorite.

The sauces could be in bigger portions, well, not the plumb sauce or the soy(?) sauce.  The only one worth eating is the orangish one with the red flakes.

Friendly service and menus in English for the lazy Amis and Limeys out there.

The wine selection is a little weak - good, better, best, red or white are the choices.  And I wish the place were gluten free.

Eat outside and then go nap in the park across the street.'

b"I was really excited to try Yumcha because I love love love dumplings and Berlin has a great food scene, so I thought this place would be heaven.  However, I was disappointed across the board.  

First, they don't serve tap water unless you are buying an alcoholic drink -- I have never seen this anywhere except a night club post midnight, and it really irritated me.

Second, the dumplings just aren't that great.  Way too big, so they are unmanageable and fall apart.  The dough is too thick and, again, lets them fall apart too easily.  And the filling is overspiced and greasy.

Third, the service sucks.  One of our orders was forgotten despite two reminders, and finally served to us over 20 minutes after we had finished the others, with not so much as an apology for the delay.  It really should have been taken off our bill, since we did not enjoy it as part of the meal.

I would not recommend going here."
b'Great dumplings! I highly recommend trying the juices too, original and yummy combinations..'
b'the dumplings taste awesome but they are a bit too pricey. Besides, the portions are small. Still, it is a place worth visiting.'
b'The dumplings are delicious, the wine is good. Geat to go with a couple other people and order lots of dumplings and share them all around. Nice teas and juices as well. Yummy Yummy!'

b"I've noticed this little place many a time, and remarked (often to myself) that its sleek exterior and savory dumpling offerings seemed promising. Well, today, I proved myself right.

We stopped in for lunch today, and seated ourselves at the pretty long wooden tables outside. Our server was a really sweet girl, and offered us menus in English. Although I'm getting better in German, it's always nice to have an option--especially so I don't have to translate every menu item for my non-Deutsch-speaking man. Yumcha Heroes has an array of daily specials, and they are proud to serve food without preservatives or any unnatural ingredients. And you can really tell--everything we had was fresh, untainted by artificiality, and thereby truly delicious.

We went with the daily special edamame--soybeans steamed and sprinkled with sea salt--which were hot and moist and perfectly tender. The sea salt was nice, and although the grains seemed sort of large at first, they continued to melt a bit and added just the right amount of saltiness. We also ordered the Shanghai dumplings (which always come steamed) and the beef dumplings with onion and ginger (which you can order steamed or fried crispy in the pan). Unfortunately, I ordered my beef dumplings steamed, but our waitress brought them out crispy. Hmm--well, no matter, I decided not to say anything, they still looked fantastic, and they were! The beef was incredibly tender, seasoned perfectly, and the accompanying dipping sauces (hot chili, soy-vinegar, and plum sauce) were a tasty addition to the already delicious flavor of the dumpling. The Shanghai dumplings were better, though, with a little bit more spice and a bit of soup in the middle! Comparing steamed to crispy, I'd say the steamed dough of the dumplings is yummier than the pan-fried. But that's just my opinion. Ooh and the crispy dumplings came with boiled bok choi with a bit of soy sauce on it. Mmmmmm. SO GOOD!

Only complaints? Our food seemed to take forever. I don't know if it's because they hand-make each set of dumplings to order--which is awesome if they do--but patience is not one of my favored virtues. Also, as mentioned, I wanted steamed dumplings but got fried. The little things, you know? Also, know that if you are super-starving, one order of dumplings for your is NOT going to do it. Order 2 for yourself, and maybe a third. 

I will most definitely be back to (hopefully) upgrade Yumcha Heroes to five pretty stars."

b"What a wonderful place! This funky little Chinese restaurant is a treat if you fancy Dim-Sum (served steamed or fried, as you wish). The design of the interior is great (have a look at the light or spend 5 minutes thinking how to get in the yellow toilet!). The portions, one could say, are rather tiny but incredibly tasty and original (about 5 euro each). They also have some salads, soups, rolls and bigger plates. There is also a good selection of wine ranging from good, better to best. We enjoyed a white Tuscan wine and a red german Weissburgunder. Each cost about 20 euro. Everybody was delighted. Their Dim-Sum are really great but I enjoyed some even better in London. Never mind! Go to Yumcha! You'll have a great evening, inside or on the patio."
b'Totally enjoyed the fresh and tasty dim sum here! Very recommendable!'

b'In de Zitty oder Tip hatte ich gelesen, dies sei DIE Adresse um tolle Dumplings zu essen...Das Essen war entt\xc3\xa4uschend. 
Die Dumplings sind zwar gut, aber nur ein klein Anteil des Angebotes. Wir haben 8 verschiedene Gerichte probiert. Die meisten waren viel zu salzig (ich konnte auch durch die Vitrine der K\xc3\xbcche sehen, wie gerne der Koch Salz in die Saucen reintut...). Die Mischung von Zutaten passten manchmal nicht, Soja und Koriander waren \xc3\xbcberall zu finden...


 Die Bedienung war sehr nett. Leider ist das Ambiente nicht so einladend weil der Restaurant rote Neon Lichte benutzt, die eher an das Lied Roxane (the Police) erinnern....'

b"This place is the reason I signed up for Yelp. Food was fine, if that's all that mattered in a restaurant, this place would have 5 stars. But the waitstaff was the most rude and disgraceful of any place I may have ever been to in the city. It wasn't just us they were rude to, two waitresses loudly reprimanded a 60+ year old women with a party of 8 because she had two of her party cancel and didn't call to tell them. We had one waitress take our order, and then 5 minutes later another, when we explained we already placed our order the second waitress gave us attitude. I paid the waitress with a 50 euro bill, now I know in Berlin a 50 can sometimes be like paying with a bar of solid gold, but she tried to say she wouldn't take it and demanded I pay with something else. The order was around 30 euros so breaking it wouldn't be the end of the world. She made me wait about 15 minutes before giving me change, and this was a friday night, not an empty wednesday afternoon. Really, this place has so much going for it, good food, beautiful interior design, nice logo work and menu layout. If they fired the two waitresses from the night I was there I'd definitely go back. But I'm not giving a single euro to a place that has so little respect for clientele."
b'toll hier. bei yumcha Heroes bekommt man wirklich leckere asiatische Gerichte. preislich spielt sich das ganze eher im oberen Segment ab, aber der Mittagstisch ist mit 7,5 Euro recht angemessen.'

b'Hard to find good authentic Chinese food in the area that are willing to make the food as spicy as we would like it to be. 

The owner was quick to help us order the correct amount of spice and the woman cooking in the back was responsive to the spice level. Normally, Germans do not like much spice in their food. Rest assured if you ask for spicy food, you will get it. 

Really enjoyed the variety of food available. 4 different items, 3 drinks for 50\xe2\x82\xac is a good meal. We will be back!'

b"Best Chinese food I've ever had! No English menus but the waitress was beyond helpful. I actually ate here on my one night alone while my husband was at a work conference, and enjoyed every bite of my solo dining experience!"

b"This is my favorite Chinese restaurant by far. Their food is excellent - I have never had a dish I didn't like - and the staff is friendly and helpful. If you happen to be in the area around lunch time, try one of their soups (with fresh, homemade noodles!). The dishes can get quite spicy, but you can always ask beforehand if you're not sure."

b"I haven't been to China, but this is what I picture as more of (from what I've seen on TV and from how friends describe it) as more authentic Chinese cuisine. Small place, very quaint but nice. My wife and brother in law had a chicken dish with green veggies (mostly onions and Lima beans, IIRC). It was very light in flavor, but in a good way. They both really liked it. I had a hot broth dish with some really great chili spices, beef, potatoes, and veggies. It had some real kick to it, but was pretty great. They served a family pot of white rice to eat everything with. Ended up being a little over \xe2\x82\xac10 per person I think. We will definitely be back here to try more dishes, strongly recommend."
b"This place is perfectly authentic! It's a small tidy restaurant, the dishes are so delicious and the price is reasonable. You can ask for recommendations and you won't be disappointed!"

b"After living in Taiwan for a while a few years ago, I always missed it's food and especially beef noodle soups. This is as close as it gets, in a very authentic small restaurant with great prices. \n\nIf you want Taiwanese food, this is the place for you."

b"Listen up people. Shits about to get real. This place, Lon Mens, is a temple. A temple of flavour. 

Chilli wan tans, is what you need to order. 

Trust me. Now did you really think that with all this flavour, you wouldnt get some sort of attitude? Come on man, dont ever play yourself! The man of the house (lil older dude) had gotten a lil crankey over the years, so if you get treated like shit, dont trip - its part of the experience. Apart from that, and that this place is always packed, this is one of the greatest places everyone and no one knows about. If you reading this, then congratulations. You just got the bestest berlin tip ever my fren. They dont come often, and they usually aren't free. But ey, its ya lucky day. Now go pack your shit, go grab your wife and kids, leave the dog at home and get the fuck over there. Do something for your health, dont be a lonely man and come on down to Lon-Mens. Peace n love,
Ya neighbour hood man
Peng. C"

b"I was here earlier for dinner, and I must say I wasn't too impressed.

We were early enough to not stand up and wait for a table. We ordered noodle soups and some dim sum as well as pig ears. Nothing life altering. Slightly overhyped even, I must say. The noodles were just okay, and I had better noodles before. Perhaps I am biased with ramen, but the noodles here had a flat uni-dimensional taste. And the dim sum and pig ears were also just ordinary.

I know other Chinese places that have more interesting items on the menu. So I don't think I'd be back here again, unless this is the only open option.

Oh, the air circulation inside could be improved."
b'Not bad, not great. Portions of non soups small and a bit pricey. Not overly flavorful. Busy but fast and friendly service.'
b'It was a pleasant surprise to find this very authentic noodle shop in Berlin.  I ordered the beef noodle soup and spicy wontons.  Both were very good.'

b"We came because we heard this was the best dim sum joint in town -it was good, but not life altering. We had chicken soup, the combination dumplings, the house fried dumplings, and peanut sesame noodles. The soup was delicious and the star of the show -moist chicken and a flavorful Thai broth, the combination dumplings were good, but 5\xe2\x82\xac for 4 small dumplings was steep. The house dumplings were very delicious -very flavorful. The price on these was a little better (10 dumplings for 8\xe2\x82\xac) -but still quite expensive. The peanut sesame noodles were good -they were served a little tepid. I would've preferred them served hot, cold, or at least warm. Overall, the food was good, but expensive for the portions and I've had better. The customer service was great. We were seated and served quickly. The food was made fresh from the kitchen, viewable from the dining room."
b'Incredible fried dumplings and very tasty beef, duck and pork knuckle noodles. \nThe restaurant is small and there are usually big lines but it is worth the wait. It is also very clean.'

b"I read quite alot good review about this place before I actually got here. Although the Noodle House is facing the main steet, my partner and I did drove pass it. And have to check the house number to find the place. The shop is actually not so big. so better keep your eyes on their shop sign or the house number, if you on the way.

I have been looking forward to pay a visit for quite a long time, until recently finally got the chance for this. So as soon as we sat down, we were just looking for something nice from the meun. Of course, I ordered noodle soups with beef and fried noodle with beed as well. The soup one I think was alright. Probably, because I knew some other great noodle soup places. I really like the Fired noodle, it tasted very fine and delicated. Also we order XiaoLong Dao as side dish. it tasted good as well, but the potion was just small for us.

This place isn't self-service. It took a small while the staff came to us. The price of the place is great."
b"If looking for an Asian cuisine with attention to quality, it's a good place. Prices are reasonable. The space for guests is limited, but it matches the prices. (Google translator)"

b'Good taiwanese noodles place in Berlin. The beef brisket noodles \xe7\x89\x9b\xe8\x82\x89\xe9\x9d\xa2 were good but the broth could be a bit more flavorful. The beef cut was so yummy tho!

We also got xiaolongbao which was ok. The skins were a bit too thick but they arent a xiaolongbao \xe5\xb0\x8f\xe7\xac\xbc\xe5\x8c\x85 specialist so what we had was already acceptable. The dimsum combo (with hagaw \xe8\x99\xbe\xe9\xa5\xba and siumai \xe7\x83\xa7\xe5\x8d\x96) was not that good though. 

Super cheap price and generous portion. Plus, super friendly service. The place is a bit small and might get a bit crowded during peak hours.'

b'Delicious chilli dumplings, tasty noodle soups! Great prices and even if there is a line, it goes fast and is worth the wait! Heard about this place on vice channels "chefs night out" and since I\'m obsessed with noodle soups, HAD to take a break from all the d\xc3\xb6ner and come when I was visiting Berlin.'

b"I was in town for a conference but since the conference center (CityCube Berlin) offered very few options for food, I decided to look for other lunch options accessible by transit. I found this Taiwanese restaurant with great Yelp reviews, only three train stops from CityCube, so I decided to give it a try. Since I grew up eating Taiwanese food and was just recently in Taiwan, my expectations were quite high. I ordered a small beef noodle soup (recommended by other Yelpers), xiao long bao (XLB), and shrimp dumplings. Although it was a treat to even have the options to eat Taiwanese food in Berlin, I was unfortunately not impressed by the food. XLB had no soup (isn't that the whole point of eating XLB??), the texture of the shrimp dumping skin was too sticky that it was impossible to pick them up without breaking them open, and the beef noodle soup didn't have Taiwanese flavor. I probably would have enjoyed the dishes more if I wasn't expecting authentic Taiwanese food... Other than that everything else was good- nice, friendly staff who can communicate in English, easy to get to by public transit, and reasonably priced meals. I would recommend eating here only if the expectation is to not have authentic Taiwanese food, because objectively they are relatively good, just not Taiwanese in my opinion."
b"A place for comfort food and authentic Taiwanese noodles. The workers are very friendly and service is fast. It's quite a small place though so you might have to queue up a bit during peak hours."
b'Visit Berlin hoping to get a nice experience of Taiwanese food. The man at the restaurant is so rude, I feel so silly even bothered going to his restaurant.'
b"A tiny place with usually long queue. But food is cheap and tasty. Their 'chilly oil dumpling' is must try."

b'I read the reviews and since it is in our neighborhood, we went to check it out. I have never tried Taiwanese food, so I do no have anything to compare it with. The waiter was very friendly and patient enough to explain us some dishes. I ordered a large portion of their specialty soup with beef for 6.50 EUR. It is a large bowl with vegetables, noodles, beef and a good tasting broth. The prices are decent and I will have to come back for other dishes.

The ambiance is nice and simple. The staff is friendly, attentive and helpful. The place has approx. 10 tables (more or less) and the small restaurant is clean and comfortable. 

I will go back again to learn more about Taiwanese food.'

b'This was my 4th visit to Lon Men\'s and this time Dim Sum only. Nice sunny spring day and we were lucky to snatch a table outside. The duck bun should be listed as "heavenly dream". I had a foodgasm. Sure, this place is super busy because of the excellent food. I live in Neukoelln but happily trek on out to Charlottenburg, knowing I\'m gonna be in heaven once again.'

b"Delicious Taiwanese food!   I love the noodle soup with a side of crispy duck.  My son loves the chicken drumstick noodle soup...I mean, all are delicious.  I'm sure I'll be spending many a cold winter day here..  Appetizers such as xiao long bao soup dumplings were also great...honestly:  just go.  Now."
b"It is great Place for a fast meal. \nIt's very small but all original handmade food. \nEverybody have to try this food."

b"I was in town for two weeks on a solo trip and this joint was one of the few Chinese / Taiwanese places that seemed noteworthy, especially given that they actually sell \xe7\x89\x9b\xe8\x82\x89\xe9\xba\xb5. That said, I was slightly miffed that their \xe7\x89\x9b\xe8\x82\x89\xe9\xba\xb5 seemed to follow the Mainland tradition of the dish; I was pretty hyped up about the prospect of eating a Taiwanese-styled \xe7\x89\x9b\xe8\x82\x89\xe9\xba\xb5. The \xe5\xb0\x8f\xe7\xb1\xa0\xe5\x8c\x85 was okay, but overall the place is priced really well. If you're feeling like you want some good Chinese food while in Berlin, be sure to stop by!"

b"As a Taiwanese-American, I was elated to find Taiwanese food in Berlin. I'm a pretty tough critic, but overall I enjoyed my experience at Lon-Men which brought me back to typical Taiwanese restaurants in California or Taiwan.

Starting from the best, the beef noodle soup was very good, lots of heat (you'll be sweating), with tender beef, the noodles were a bit flimsy for me but that could be personal preference. The pork chop with dry noodles were good, chili oil wontons just ok IMHO (I have a high standard, few places ever get it right), and gua bao was disappointing, lacking on filling and flavors (go to Street Food Thursday/Bao Kitchen).

Despite my criticisms, I will definitely go back to try more dishes, I'm still just happy I can find Taiwanese food in Berlin! Plus the staff is friendly :)"

b'I had never had been one for soups for dinner and was quite skeptical about it, but with the more than pleasant reviews on Yelp I decided to give it a try. Thank GOD I did. This was wonderful. The waiters are wonderful and helpful. And the noodle soup with crispy duck was phenomenal. Also the dim sum was clearly made by the gods.'

b"What is better than a bowl of piping hot soup noodle on a chilly autumn day? Nothing, that's what! Pair it with some pot stickers or steamed dumplings and my life is completed. This hole-in-the-wall place has truly authentic Taiwanese soup noodle and dumplings. Everything we had was delicious. The owner was super nice too. It can get a little crowded at lunch time, thou, but that all add to the experience I think. I felt like I was in a Taiwanese night market noodle shop. :D"

b"Great little Taiwanese restaurant on kantstr. It feels really authentic. Started with wontons with chile oil - amazing and duck bun appetizer - a little dry and falls apart as you eat. We asked the owner/waiter for recommendations on other dishes and without realizing exactly what we ordered, both ended up with the noodle soup with beef slices. Lost in translation, oh well. It was very good but not enough to order again.

Also ordered the Taiwanese maultaschen/dumplings with pork filling. They were excellent, somewhat similar to the wontons. They had tsing tao beer and krombacher, the first was kind of flat and the latter was good but no beer on tap that night, too bad.

Overall a great experience - just know you're going to a hole-in-the-wall restaurant with good food but nothing fancy and you might come out smelling like you spent a day in the kitchen. Phew!"

b"One billion times yes!

While living in Berlin I ate here at least twice a week. During the heat of the summer the inside seating area can get pretty toasty, and that my friends, is the only downside. This place has the most amazing food. I still dream about the chili wonton and the duck bao. 

I am salivating just thinking about it. 

I never had a dish that I did not like and the owner was so kind. Also, I never had any problems speaking english here so don't be shy, there will be no Germanic eye-rolling here."

b"Amazing little Taiwanese restaurant with the best dumplings that I have ever tasted.  I grew up going to Wo Hops on Mott Street in Chinatown, NYC, and this hole in the wall rivals how much I loved that place.  Everything is cooked fresh in the tiny open kitchen in the front and there are a few tables in the back.  Probably not the place to go for a larger group.  The chili dumplings are addictive and all the noodle dishes were great.They have an English speaking server and the service is as soon as the dish is ready, which means you may get your main course before your appetizer.  Good portions, cheap prices, and you can get it to go (takeaway).  Don't miss this one!"

b'As a part Taiwanese transplant I was happy to find this place, and even happier to try the food. The beef noodles here were good, although I can\'t say they are what I would expect from Taiwanese beef noodles based on California and Taiwan experiences. But very happy to have it and will return for the beef noodles, as close to a home feeling I can get in Berlin. The "dim sum" sampler was perfectly acceptable, but you would be disappointed if you\'re used to California dim sum.'

b"One of my favourite places to eat some noodle soup and dim sum. I don't know where to start: the food is amazing, the owners are adorable and funny,  the price is more than fair. I really like it to bring friends here who haven't tried dim sum yet. Go for the ha cao ones (with shrimp filling) they are the best!"

b'Tiny little place , looks like a takeaway place but you can sit there. Just by the look of the place one would underestimate it. But say it Berlin style or Taiwan street style, the food is authentic and yummy.The duck bao, the dumplings and the soups really pleases your taste buds.'

b'It was a busy place. Had to wait 20 minutes for a table. Had the beef noodles and spicy wonton. Food was just okay. Taste was in the mediocre side and portions were small. I have had better noodles in Berlin. I had high expectations based on the reviews but I think this place is overrated.'
b'Beef noodle soup is quite good especially the meat, but the noodle could be better! Side dish marinated beef tastes good as well and won ton in chili sauce also recommended!'

b'If yelp had half stars, this would be a 4.5. Prices were fair and everything tasted delicious. If you were thinking about getting the wonton in chili, you must get it! My girlfriend and I devoured them before our soup came. We ordered #7 and #12 soup and ate every last bite; perfect meal after a plane ride. It felt like I was in Chinatown eating some legit Chinese food'
b'Very authentic Taiwanese cuisine. Tiny intimate place   with great snack food. Nice and fast service. I had the duck wraps and wantans and they were just delicious!'

b"I ate noodle soup once here in 2011. The taste was so so. Maybe my choice didn't meet my expectation.
A week ago I had sudden craving for noodle soup. A colleague of mine suggested this place again, saying that a lot of taiwanese eat here and I should try beef noodle soup.
OK, so I went there and ordered for 2:

- Pork ear: Tasted good. I love the sauce, it's just that it was so thinly sliced and there were more cucumber than pork ear
- Duck bun: Was OK as appetizer
- Guotie (dumpling/gyoza in japanese): Was OK
- Beef noodle soup: Was delicious. I love the broth. The broth wasn't as thick as ramen broth, which I normally prefer, but it was tasty!
- Wantan noodle soup: The noodle and soup were also tasty but wantan was so so."

b"This noodle house in Charlottenburg has a lot of competition in the form of elegant looking restaurants all over the street. Yet this low-budget Taiwanese restaurant stands its ground, it is frequently visited and recommended quite often. A food blogger like me now has the duty of finding out why.
I had a good seat on the street and ordered a noddle beef soup. In short, it lacked a little bit of flavour in my opinion. Sure, I could make up for it with soy sauce and these super spicy red sauces that you find in every chinese restaurant. Yet, something was missing. I cannot name anything particular, it was just the overall image. But I didn't want to sound too harsh, it is still a good choice. And what I want to underline is the fact that a little too less flavor is still hundred times better than artificial flavor. I think you agree with me, at least on that regard

further information under:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Food-Wonder-Berlin/1467512866851370?fref=ts"
b'Really authentic place with great noodle soup and dumplings. Incredibly nice owners. Tastes just like in Taiwan!'

b"I ordered duck with vegetables and noodles, it was a REALLY small portion and there were no veggies except lettuce, i was expecting way more form that place than what I got. My boyfriend got beef noodle soup and wasn't satisfied with either.\nIn comparison to other asian places, you don't get enough food for the price."

b'Real food, no bullshit! Often very busy, but its worth the wait ( chairs line up outside, so u can sit an wait for a free table) friendly staff, very laid back atmosphere. Good homemade food for really good prices. Soup was awsome, dim sum was awsome!'

b"This is the best (by far) and most fairly priced Taiwanese/Chinese noodle/soup place in Berlin. I've tried many others and this place remains my number one choice. You will see why when you see the gigantic pots where the broth simmers for hours for the right consistency. Great choice during Berlin's unfriendly winters (but I go there in summer too!)."

b'I am extremely disappointed with the food & service tonight. First of all, the old men who took our order was pretty rude. I asked what the difference is between the no.2 & 15. Anyhow, he raised his voice and cut me off completely. Then I said to myself:"some places which serve awesome food just don\'t give a f&$k on the service side, maybe the food will make up for the poor service ". NO! That didn\'t happen. My boyfriend had so called Taiwanese beef noodle soup. The broth taste like water mixed with a bit of soy sauce, beef slice has not much flavor plus they were chewy. I ordered the crispy duck with dry noodles. Duck was nice but balance isn\'t quite right in the sauce. Oh we also ordered the wonton in chilli oil - again weird sauce. Last but not least we also ordered the buns. Omg... this is probably one of the worst meals I have ever had. I also have serious doubts whether this so called Taiwanese restaurant is run by Taiwanese...'
b'Awesome place with perhaps the best snd most interesting food on the affordable level. Try the dumplings or a soup!'

b"Amazing authentic Chinese cuisine. Had the pork knuckle noodle soup, roast duck dumplings and roast duck bun. So delicious I can't stop thinking about this establishment . Now I  am in Miami longing for more. When in Berlin you must try this Noodle House."

b"After more than a week of European food, this was ALL I wanted in Berlin! The place was tiny, but the service was fast and friendly. Our noodles came quickly and had piping hot tasty broth with plenty of beef slices. I wish the noodles themselves were a bit thicker, but really, that's just being nitpicking, especially considering how cheap they were."

b"Having sampled similar fare in Taiwan, mainland China, and Southern California's San Gabriel Valley, I have to report that Lon-Men's Taiwan-style noodle shop is not all that great. We had a pork-chop rice place, marinated-beef rice plate, fried dumplings, and vegetables. The dumplings were the best, but none of these dishes was special. The interior was hot as Hades (sidewalk tables were filled up), and the staff and owner tried to make the two of us move from a roomy table for 4 to a tiny table for 2--very annoying when there were many empty tables in the place, and when two other tables for 4 were occupied by lone diners (we declined to move but promised to do so if the place filled up, which it didn't). No reason to return, especially with other Chinese restaurants on the street looking more promising."

b"Disclaimers: i am chinese, but fam is from HK so my preferences tend to lie in canto food. 

if you order exactly this: 1. Crispy duck buns 2. spicy wontons 3. beef noodle soup you will love this place! 

Tried the soup dumplings - they are just dumplings, no soup like traditional XLB has. small size soup was perf for me, the bf also had the small size, and he's a large german, so with the small soup + dim sum bits, you're good and about to be very full!"

b"I stumbled upon this hole in the wall the other day. Seriously great place given the low prices and great tasting food. Try the noodles with seame and peanut oil. It's seriously delicious!  The hot and sour soup was great as well. Can't wait to go back!"

b"have eaten there about ten timesalways very good food.everything except the spring rolls, which taste JUST LIKE the frozen ones you buy at all the Asian markets here, which is shocking considering the dishes are so delicious.but everything else if very good!!! and the service is very nice tooi'm glad its not so close to my house or i would be eating there every single day cause its also very inexpensive!!"

b"This food is delicious! Never heard of such a place before, but was simply walking by as I had to wait an hour for my appointment at the Zullasungstelle down the street. Walked in, met a very friendly staff that recommended me the Beef dumplings, and I also ordered the pumpkin/pea dumplings. I'm literally just through the pumpkin/pea dumplings right now and realized I had to write in Yelp asap about these guys. \n\nIn the picture is the beef dumplings only (b9 on the menu I believe) as I was starving and chomped on the pumpkin/pea set immediately. Highly recommended and I'll be back here even without an appointment at the Zulassungstelle! :-)"

b"Set in a beautiful part of the Kreuzberg area called Bergmannkiez, this neighborhood eatery provides delicious dumplings and relaxing atmosphere. Whether you decide to sit outside on the street and watch the passers by or inside, you'll surely enjoy anyone of Cha for Tee's broad menu of meat-filled and vegetarian dumplings.

I went with an appetizer of pork wanton soup, which really hit the spot. Later, I hit the pork dumplings with cabbage and coriander. It was quite good--not the best dumplings I've ever had--but definitely satisfying enough and well worth the price.

But the real piece de resistance of the joint is the desert. I got the pastry dumplings (set of two) which came I are with coffee out on the street-side tables.

All and all, it was a perfect way to spend a late Sunday afternoon."

b"If you are craving dumplings or some semblance of Chinese food, this place is fine. They have a homemade chili oil sauce that I liked. The dan dan mian was tasty, but it lacked the boldness that I am used to. Xiao long bao was a disappointment --flavor was decent, but most of my soup dumplings didn't have soup. Ma la ro was acceptable.\n\nIf this is your only option for Chinese, you'll be fine. Good service, nice ambiance and plenty of seating on a quiet street near templehof. It was a very pleasant experience nonetheless. CASH ONLY."
b'The place is in a very cute area~there are many different kinds of dumplings here, and they are colorful! Good dumplings!'

b'This place is so cute. And super tasty. We tried the green bean appetizer and several of the vegetarian and pork dumplings. All are highly recommended- especially the green beans. The tea selection was crazy. The only draw-back was that the dumplings take a while to steam. We ordered another round after our first and then one more for dessert and ended up staying quite a while, even for European standards. But the atmosphere is nice so no real complaints here!'

b'For Chinese Food in Berlin on New Years Eve, without reservations, this was a solid choice.  Service was fast, the menu was extensive, and the dishes I ordered were perfect.  It\'s a large "hall" style Chinese restaurant, with a lot of tables, and a few smaller seating areas built inside, but it wasn\'t too noisy, and didn\'t feel cramped at all.\n\nI\'d definitely go back if I wanted Chinese food and were in Mitte.'

b"I am not really a Chinese enthusiast, but the food, service, and location is good. I ordered the mini vegetable egg rolls, fried noodles with chicken, fried noodles with beef, chicken, and another meat that I can't remember, and fried rice.  I would definitely stop by again if I were in the area."
b'The most authentic Chinese restaurant I found so far in Berlin, should not be missed for ones looking for real Chinese foods but western Asian.'

b'As a suggestion from one of my co-workers in Berlin, I ate here with my boss during a business trip to Berlin for dinner.  What a great choice!

The service was fast, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was okay.  Plus it was in walking distance from the Courtyard Marriott where we were staying.

Another place on my list when staying in Berlin.'

b"Lots of options but the quality isn't that great. The staff is helpful. I do like the ambience. Spacious. I got the fried noodles with chicken, beef and vegetables. It was a bit too oily and not all that flavourful. For what you pay you can get better portions elsewhere."
b'Too much MSG and the green peppers tasted moldy. might have been my taste buds so I give three stars. overall quite generic.'

b"Avoid at all costs if you don't to be treated as an intrusion rather than paying customer. I usually trust Yelp reviews because I know the reviewers care about great food as much as I do but this time I totally disagree with previous reviewers.

We chose this restaurant due to its closeness to our hotel rather than one with better reviews a distance away.  From the minute we entered I have never encountered such disdain, rudeness and lack of interest on behalf of the restaurant staff.  After 10 minutes after seating we still had not been greeted at table even though only 3 tables filled in restaurant.  Eventually got attention of waiter and the evening went down after.  His attitude was downright hostile - could it have been because we spoke English and not German? We were  a diverse group with Malaysia, Indonesia, Indian and US represented out to have a nice business dinner.

Now the food- pan fried dumplings okay, soups poor. Mains- crispy duck in Szechuan sauce & prawns in paprika-pepper both 3.5 stars.  Fried fish filet with mushrooms - no flavor & no fish!  Sweet & sour pork - 2 stars.

Decor- dated tacky Chinese decor with abundance of dirty/dusty fake flowers everywhere.

All in all- would have give 3 star but cannot tolerate or accept such rude and indifferent wait staff."
b'Very good Chinese restaurant! Cook very fast and delicious! There is always a lot of visitors ... Very often it eat and enjoy!'

b"The food and service were both outstanding  I highly recommend this place. 

It is a quiet little restaurant with a relaxing atmosphere. The service was great. They brought our dishes out on a warmer so we could take our time eating and it never got cold. 

They have a great selection of dishes and drinks. So if you're looking for a place with great prices and great food, this is it!"
b'Good pricess and good chinese food. I have only went there for a take-away meal. Perfect for that.'

b'We go here almost every week since we have moved in this neighborhood. The typical decorated spacy place is purely family-driven, owner Si Mei is very very friendly. The food is mandarin cuisine, just excellent and prizes are absolutely low. My recommendation is the hot plate with prawns.'
b'very delicious! especially all kinds of local Cantonese style DIM-SUM, which stands out among other chinese restaurant~'

b'Like just : AMAZING ! 
once you go there ...you'll just wish /want to move to Berlin just to be able to try all dishes EVERY DAY !
on top of being delicious they are decorated in such an exquisite and elegant way that can only assure you "you won't be disappointed"
hope you will all enjoy as much as i did. definitely recommendable! 
service is super sweet, the place has a great decoration, all is very clean
my best advise is : GO ! GO ! GO!  TRY! TRY!'

b"Visiting from New York City  for only five days and was lucky enough to be brought to this exquisite restaurant by my friend Jake. Better than any of the restaurants back home - freshest flavors and most delicious combinations I've encountered. Tofu has never tasted so good - whether quickly deep fried or saut\xc3\xa9ed or smoked. Shumai and wontons were perfect and light and wasabi shrimp out of this world.  And how can a humble cucumber salad be that amazing?\nGracious service; beautiful outdoor setting, lovely bottle of Albari\xc3\xb1o and above all scrumptious food. A must."
b"Nothing special. It's pretty much your average Chinese place, but a bit more expensive. The dim sum is better than the Hauptgerichte."

b'Really confused by the reviews and I am not even a foodie.  I had their version of Kung Po chicken and it was almost inedible and the dish was about 50% oyster sauce with very little meat.  They do have a nice outdoor eating area if you just want to have a beer, but I would stay away from the food if you are remotely used to real Chinese food.'

b"GREAT FOOD! I've been here twice this week, once because I needed soup for a stupid cold. Twice, because the soup was amazing! 

Get the wan-tan suppe with pork. It's bursting with delicious wan-tans stuffed with minced pork and scallions, fresh veggies, and yummy broth. 

The restaurant can be a little empty early on, but ignore it because the food is SO GOOD. The service is fast and friendly.  I hope to come back one more time before the end of this trip, to try the spicy vermicelli noodles with pork."

b"We had a craving for hot pot, so we crossed our fingers and looked for the closest place in Berlin. Lo and behold, it was less than 0.3km away so we tried it and were incredibly satisfied when we left.

We tried the spicy and Chinese herbal soup bases, and thought it tasted slightly bland and not as spicy. However, we satisfied by how cheap it was for all-you-can-eat (13.50\xe2\x82\xac per person). The downside was that water and tea were extra charge. 

The downside was some of the meat wasn't as fresh as we had hoped. The tripe and prawns looked dodgy so we opted for vegetables and beef, which were fine."

b"Fairly good food and experience, service was friendly. My duck was tasty. Unfortunately I woke up at about 2am with MSG head-ache and didn't get back to sleep for the rest of the night. They do mention that they use MSG in their menu, however if you're not used to eating I'd recommend staying well-clear of this place, because they obviously apply it by the truckload. Otherwise, if you're immune to the effects of MSG, I heartily recommend it."
b"If you feel like warming a frozen body with a yummy hot pot, this is a great place. They have an unlimited all your can eat hotpot deal. It's definitely worth money."

b'People seem to come here for the hot pot. We ordered from the menu and were deeply disappointed. Being Chinese myself i have high standards for Chinese cuisine and low tolerance for dishes seasoned with supermarket oyster sauce and the like. The sauce for the mapo tofu was definitely out of a can, and the sauce for the garlic eggplant as well. The dumplings were good but frozen industrial. This does not apply for the quality of hot pot, which I have not tried.'
b'Hot pot is quite ok.  Variety of hot pot dish is not so much, but still quite authentic hot pot! Recommended!'
b'Had the Hot Pot here, it was pretty good.  Menu was pretty good as well.  Have gone back.'
b'Been here at least 3 times already. Good interior design, tasty food, friendly staff. Recommeded!'
b'Mix dim sum is fresh and tasty. The location is also very good. Very near the U-bahn station.'

b"Casual dining, Chinese restaurant located a short walk up the road from the Friedrichstra\xc3\x9fe rail station in Mitte (~5min walk). 

Menu includes a range of typical Chinese dishes, but the real attraction is their 'hot pot' specials where they set up a simmering pot of soup (you can get the soup as mild or spicy as you like) on a burner in the middle of the table with a variety of seafood, meats, vegetables and noodles to cook at the table. It's the perfect way to warm up on a chilly day! Prices for the hot pot combinations are very reasonable, making this a good value and fun way to share a meal with a group 

I have not tried many of the items from the regular menu, but did order their noodle soup for lunch once - I was not particularly impressed by it. Stick to the hot pot if you feel like a warm soup/noodle type of meal. 

They also have a small range of dim sum that are quite tasty bites. I like making a meal of it by ordering a few different items. Depending on how hungry I am, I can order more or less. My favorite here is the har gaw (steamed shrimp dumpling) with a nice dip in chili sauce before popping into my mouth."
b'OMG, food coma, reminds me of my days in China. Just the variety of sauces and quality of meat a tick below CN level. Actually surprising, but local food is maybe always best.'

b"This was an excellent Chinese restaurant we happened upon our last night in Berlin.  Although we each had an entree (mine was actually not Chinese, but rather a curry - don't ask), we'd shared an assortment of dim sum (10 pieces).  They were excellent!  While both of our main courses were good, we'd eaten so many dumplings (and that's what we like the most, anyway), that we would have preferred just sticking with the dim sum for our whole meal.

I also had a mango lassi (I know, also not Chinese), that was very good, though not as good as Zum Moghulhof in Vienna (home of the Best Mango Lassi known to me).

I would definitely return to this restaurant for the dim sum, and the friendly service."

b"I was with a couple of buddies of and we happened to stumble at this AYCE place at Oranienburger Tor.  This place is honestly fantastic; we had heaps of fish, meat and delicious broth. I've gone hot pot hopping in Berlin, and I think this is genuinely one of the best places in Berlin from a hot pot perspective. I would definitely go again with my buddies sometime soon!"

b'Fun place for a group of friends. Pretty authentic Chinese hotpot with choices of soup bases - ranging from mild to very spicy.\nEat as much as you want for a fixed price with a selection of meat/seafood and vegetables. Choices could be better - e.g. different meats, veg etc.\nOverall, great value, nice surrounding and fun. Was pretty stuffed at the end of it so make sure you have empty stomach to get the most out of it!'

b"This place does an unbeatable Sichuan hotpot (or steamboat) for 12.80 Euro for all you can eat. The stocks for the steamboat are pretty authentic although I didn't agree with the peanut dipping sauce too much. There are 3 platters that come with the steamboat, a mix of vegetables and noodles, a mix of fish and cow belly (which is much nicer than it sounds) and a meat platter of chicken, pork, beef and lamb. All of that goes into the hot boiling stocks and then you stuff your face as much as you want. Watch out for the dark Sichuan stock - it's apparently a bit too fiery for some people though it was quite tame for me. It all sounds good but after the second round, it gets a bit same-ish and one can end up rather bloated. But it is still a fun night out and a great economical place to take your friends for an unusual dinner!"

b'Was einem am Lucky Star zun\xc3\xa4chst auff\xc3\xa4llt ist die tolle Inneneinrichtung mit einer Kombination aus chinesischen Elementen und deutschem Stuck die sehr ansprechend wirkt.
